title: Dancing at Paul Taylor, a New Generation Finds Its Footing
description: At this moment, the Paul Taylor Dance Company is both transformed and not. Its founder and choreographer, Taylor, died in 2018, but what remains, despite a new generation of dancers, is fundamental: the supple strength of the Taylor dancing body.

title: Democrats Promote Tough-on-Crime Credentials as Party Plays Defense
description: In the final stretch of the midterm campaigns, Democrats are straining to defend themselves against a barrage of crime-focused attacks from Republicans, forcefully highlighting their public safety credentials amid signs that G.O.P. messaging on the issue may be more potent than usual in some critical races this year.

title: What Twitters Shake-Up Could Mean: Midterm Misinformation Run Amok
description: A recent exchange between David Becker, a nonpartisan elections expert, and a Twitter user named @catturd2  an account with nearly a million followers that sometimes exchanges posts with Elon Musk, the worlds richest man and the new owner of Twitter  offered a telling example of why misinformation is such an intractable problem.

title: Former New York Police Officer Convicted in Freezing Death of Son
description: A Long Island jury on Friday convicted a former New York City police officer in the death of his 8-year-old son, an autistic boy who died from hypothermia nearly three years ago after his father forced him to sleep in a freezing garage.

title: The last day of early voting in Georgia saw long lines, an unexpected endorsement and a big retirement.
description: ATLANTA  Georgias last day of early voting was arguably the busiest of the states entire election season, marked not only by a high volume of voters at the polls but also by a surprise endorsement and a major retirement.

title: Nancy Pelosi Says Her Husbands Recovery Will Be a Long Haul
description: WASHINGTON  In her first publicly broadcast comments since her husband, Paul Pelosi, was attacked by an intruder at the couples San Francisco home, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said his recovery was going to be a long haul, but he will be well.

title: Jan. 6 Committee Gives Trump More Time to Comply With Subpoena
description: WASHINGTON  The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol said Friday it was in discussions with former President Donald J. Trump and his lawyers about his compliance with the panels subpoena, giving him additional time to respond.

title: Humblebrag, of a Sort
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  This is John Westwigs second Saturday puzzle in a row for The Times. His crossword has all the hallmarks of a great themeless grid: intimidating single-word clues that send me back to my days of vocabulary tests, wordplay that requires a second (or third) take, and interesting trivia that at first appears more obscure than it is. Even so, the solve manages to not be too frustrating; it is also fresh without being trendy, mainly because of reasonable crosses throughout.

title: Michigan G.O.P. offers a show of unity at a homestretch rally.
description: CLINTON TOWNSHIP, Mich.  As the midterm campaign enters the homestretch, its time for unity rallies.

title: Quotation of the Day: Worries Rise, and Wrecks Emerge, as a River Dries Up
description: Were the main vein of the country. This is never supposed to dry out.

title: Corrections: Nov. 5, 2022
description: An article on Friday about the refugee crisis in Europe caused by the war in Ukraine misstated Sasha Kovtutskyis marital status. He and his partner are being hosted in Munich, but they are not married.

title: Daria Kasatkinas Tumultuous and Triumphant Season
description: FORT WORTH  As Daria Kasatkinas match with the American teenager Coco Gauff took many a twist and turn on Thursday night, Kasatkinas thoughts were hard to read: Her neutral, deeply focused expression gave little hint of the score until she had closed out her round-robin victory, 7-6 (6), 6-3, at the WTA Finals with a roar and a clenched fist.

title: The U.S. and Europe seek to assure Ukraine of support.
description: With soaring inflation and energy prices in the United States and Europe stoking concerns in Ukraine that support for the war could wane, the United States and its allies sought this past week to offer Ukraine strong assurances that their military and financial commitment to the war effort would not waver.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SATURDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Miami-Dade County Was Once a Lock for Democrats. Not Anymore.
description: Republicans believe they have a good chance of capturing Miami-Dade County in the Florida governors race for the first time in two decades on Tuesday, a feat that would have been nearly unthinkable only six years ago, when Hillary Clinton won the pivotal county by a staggering 29 percentage points in her presidential contest against Donald J. Trump.

title: G.O.P. Seeks to Erase Democratic Supermajority in New York Legislature
description: For four years, a cycle of victories by progressive-minded Democrats has pushed the New York State Legislature to the left, carrying their party to legislative supermajorities and creating an unfettered path for liberal priorities to be enacted around housing, climate change and abortion rights.

title: How Diverse Are the Candidates in the Midterm Elections?
description: See where underrepresented groups have made gains and where they have declined.

title: 4 Takeaways From the Campaign Trail
description: Eight months after the first primary election of 2022, Republicans and Democrats made one last blitz of campaigning before polls close on Tuesday.

title: How Putin and Friends Stalled Climate Progress
description: A handful of powerful world leaders rallied around Russia and undercut global cooperation.

title: The Worlds Peatlands Are Climate Bombs Waiting to Detonate
description: The Congo Basins Cuvette Centrale, the worlds largest complex of tropical peatlands, covers an area slightly larger than the state of New York and stores the equivalent of three years of global carbon dioxide emissions. Like other peatlands around the world, it is a potential carbon bomb. When disturbed, these swampy freshwater landscapes unleash their carbon, trapping ever more heat in the atmosphere and intensifying global warming.

title: Movement Never Lies: The Genius of Martha Graham
description: Martha always wanted to leave behind a legend, not a biography. So wrote the highly successful American choreographer Agnes de Mille about an American choreographer she was far from alone in considering a genius: Martha Graham. And a legend is what Graham left behind: not just of the chief creator of what is still called modern dance and the founder of a company now approaching its centennial, but of an all-consuming flame, a world-changer and a sacred monster, both the abusive high priestess and the sacrificial victim of a cult of art.

title: I Want to Rip Out the Tub in My Bathroom. Will That Hurt Resale Value?
description: Q: I recently bought a two-story house in Ridgewood, Queens, with a bathroom on each floor. The upstairs bathroom has a tub, and the downstairs one has a standing shower. Id like to renovate the upstairs bathroom and replace the tub with a nice walk-in shower. But is this a good investment? Should I think more about resale, or designing the bathroom that I really want?

title: Cold and Tense: 10 Americans on How Politics Changes Relationships
description: A woman in Colorado used to pride herself on engaging political opponents without judgment. But since relatives embraced Covid conspiracy theories while she was doing emergency pandemic response work, she has become viscerally wary of conservatives.

title: Biden and Obama Reunite in a Last-Ditch Effort to Save Their Party
description: PHILADELPHIA  There was a time not that long ago when Joseph R. Biden Jr. could go where Barack Obama could not, an emissary to parts of the country not exactly gushing over the 44th president. Now the tables are turned and it is Mr. Obama who jets from one battleground state to the next while the 46th president sticks largely to safe blue areas where he is still welcome.

title: Oz to Rally With Trump, a Departure From His Closing Message of Balance
description: PITTSBURGH  When Dr. Mehmet Oz talks about bringing balance to politics if he is elected to the Senate, it might seem as if he is talking about the split screen of his own campaign: the conservative-sounding candidate who won former President Donald J. Trumps crucial endorsement before the Pennsylvania primary, versus the TV doctor who is wooing suburban voters as an independent-minded voice of reason.

title: The Lingering Tragedy of Japans Lost Generation
description: I met Hiroshi S. a few years ago at a support group in Tokyo for socially isolated Japanese.

title: What Are Those Mysterious New Towers Looming Over New Yorks Sidewalks?
description: A curiously futuristic tower recently appeared on the corner of Putnam and Bedford Avenues in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn. A gray column topped by a perforated casing, at a whopping 32 feet tall, it reaches higher than the three-story brick building behind it.

title: Fed Up With Political Text Messages? Read On.
description: Boris, Florida is in trouble, warned one text message seeking campaign donations  and promising 900 percent matching funds  for Senator Marco Rubio of Florida.

title: Polling Averages Can Be Useful, but Whats Underneath Has Changed
description: The polls show Republicans gaining heading into the final stretch. Theyve pulled ahead on the generic ballot in the race for the House, and theyve fought into a closely contested race for Senate control.

title: Teaching Young Children About War Without Frightening Them
description: Childrens books  particularly picture books  that tackle the subject of war in sensitive and reassuring ways are rare. Figuring out how to explain such morbid business to children presents a serious challenge for authors and illustrators. If they truthfully depict death and destruction, they risk increasing childrens fears. If they offer false and improbable scenarios, they risk childrens mistrust.

title: Claire Keegan Harnesses the Power in Brevity
description: Claire Keegan didnt read much as a child. In her home in southeast Ireland, where her family ran a sheep, pig and cattle farm, there were just a couple of books around the house  an illustrated edition of the Bible, and a cookbook, she recalls.

title: Letitia James Makes Famous Enemies. Will That Win Her an Election?
description: Over her four years as New York attorney general, Letitia James has built a formidable national profile through her offices inquiries into former President Donald J. Trump, former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and the National Rifle Association.

title: What You Need to Know About Pivotal New Jersey Elections
description: During the last midterm election cycle in 2018, Democrats in New Jersey flipped four congressional seats blue. Next week, Republicans are hoping to win back at least some of the ground they lost.

title: YouTube May Have Misinformation Blind Spots, Researchers Say
description: No, China has not worked with Democrats to steal the midterm elections, as some people on YouTube have claimed. Nor has Saudi Arabia.

title: For These New York Farmers, Harvest Time Means High Times
description: It was a longtime cash crop in the United States, as American as apple pie.

title: Family Ties. Political Divisions.
description: In the Broe family household, even the mail is divided.

title: It Looks Like a Shell, but an Octopus and 40,000 Eggs Live Inside
description: Argonauta Argo is not a typical octopus. When a female mates, first she keeps her partners detachable, sperm-filled limb inside of her. Then she begins making something like a handbag.

title: Pranks, Parties and Politics: Ron DeSantiss Year as a Schoolteacher
description: Twenty years ago in the foothills of northwest Georgia, a new history teacher joined the faculty of one of the states oldest and largest boarding schools.

title: What Makes a Room Unforgettable?
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art. The Ace Hotel New York. The Chicago Athletic Association. The NoMad hotel in London. Goops store in Los Angeles. The Reykjavik Edition hotel, in Iceland. The Boom Boom Room.

title: Questions for Kathy Hochul and Lee Zeldin
description: New Yorks race for governor started as a prospective blowout. It will come to a close on Tuesday in a dead heat unlike anything this safely Democratic state has seen in two decades.

title: 3 Presidents Swoop Into Pennsylvania, in a Clash That Transcends 2022
description: PHILADELPHIA  The two parties strongest messengers  a fraternity of recent presidents  descended on the pivotal swing state of Pennsylvania on Saturday to open the last weekend of this years midterms, rallying their voters in a proxy battle that could define both parties well beyond the election.

title: How an Astrophysicist Spends Her Sundays
description: Jackie Faherty knew she wanted to be an astronomer after she saw Contact, the 1997 movie based on the novel by the uber-famous astronomer Carl Sagan. I walked into the theater my freshman year at Notre Dame one person, and walked out a different person, she said.

title: Republican Gains in Congress Would Pressure Biden on Ukraine and Iran
description: WASHINGTON  A Republican takeover of the House or Senate in the midterm elections next week could complicate the Biden administrations efforts to defend Ukraine, slow the confirmation of key U.S. ambassadors and lead to public interrogations of officials who were involved in the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan last year.

title: What Can U.S. Democracy Learn From Brazil?
description: BRASLIA  The run-ups to the most recent presidential elections in the Western Hemispheres two largest democracies were remarkably similar.

title: A Vibrant Refuge in Seoul Goes Quiet After Deadly Crowd Crush
description: SEOUL  Seo Hyuk-jun, 36, knelt before the white chrysanthemums as he placed a lit cigarette, incense and a paper cup filled with Jack Daniels on the ground. He stood, knelt and bowed twice, performing a traditional Korean ritual for the dead.

title: These Men Fled War in Syria to Ukraine. Now Theyve Fled Again.
description: LONDON  In a small church hall this spring in East London, some two dozen people who had fled the war in Ukraine drank tea and shared lunch as they tried to meet members of their new community.

title: Hosting Climate Summit Is Both Opportunity and Risk for Egypt
description: Follow our live coverage of the COP27 Climate Summit in Egypt.

title: Alleviating Canadas Acute Shortage of Family Doctors
description: In British Columbia this week, the provincial government took a bold, and costly, step that it hopes will help recruit family doctors for about 1 million people. Adrian Dix, the minister of health, outlined a new plan that could see a typical family doctors gross income rise by 135,000 Canadian dollars a year, to about 385,000 dollars.

title: The Fastest Woman in This Years New York City Marathon Is Israeli
description: In July, when Lonah Chemtai Salpeter crossed the finish line of the World Championship marathon in Eugene, Ore., in third place, an Israeli flag was draped around her back.

title: Time Warp
description: Tomorrow morning, in the tiniest hours, daylight saving time ends. We regain the hour we lost in the spring, one final consolation, handed out like a party favor popped into a childs loot bag to soften the blow of going home, now that the partys over, as Joan Gould wrote in The Times in 1981.

title: The Run-Up Podcast Explains the Midterm Elections
description: In 2020, Joe Bidens presidential campaign was centered on removing Donald Trump from office, unifying the country and fighting for the soul of the nation. Two years later, the country is still fractured, with voters seemingly more anxious and disconnected than ever before.

title: Medicare Advantage or Just Medicare?
description: The sales pitches show up in your mailbox and inbox, in robocalls and texts. Ads target you on radio and television and social media. Touting Medicare Advantage plans, these campaigns promise low premiums and all kinds of extra benefits.

title: Out Loud, Pumped Up and Bossed Around by the French
description: Dear readers,

title: What Will the Midterms Mean for Big Business?
description: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offer a better understanding of an important issue in business. If you dont already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

title: North Korea Launches More Missiles, and U.S. Bombers Fly Over the South
description: SEOUL  North Korea fired four short-range ballistic missiles off its west coast on Saturday morning, and hours later two American B-1B supersonic strategic bombers flew over the Korean Peninsula in the first deployment of its kind since 2017.

title: Irans foreign minister acknowledges that drones were sent to Russia, but says it happened before the war.
description: Irans foreign minister for the first time acknowledged on Saturday that his country had sent drones to Russia, according to the Iranian state news media, but said that the deliveries had all taken place before Moscows invasion of Ukraine in February.

title: This Group Has $100 Million and a Big Goal: To Fix America
description: In February 2020, in the midst of a vitriolic presidential election, an idealistic group of donors from across the ideological spectrum met to plan an ambitious new project. They called themselves the New Pluralists and pledged to spend a whopping $100 million over the next decade to fight polarization by funding face-to-face interactions among Americans across political, racial and religious divides.

title: The Marjorie Taylor Greene-ing of America
description: WASHINGTON  Are we ready for our new Republican overlords?

title: $2 Billion Powerball Ticket Sold in Los Angeles County, Lottery Officials Said
description: After an overnight delay held up the drawing of the largest jackpot in American history on Monday, lottery officials in California said Tuesday that a winning, $2 billion ticket was sold in Los Angeles County.

title: How diverse are the candidates in this election? Take a look at the numbers.
description: After a pair of triumphant elections for women and people of color in American politics, in which records were smashed in 2018 and then broken again in 2020, diverse candidates made further progress this year.

title: Democrats Ushered In the Los Angeles Sheriff. Now Many Want Him Gone.
description: The deputies wore tactical gear as they descended on the white colonial in Santa Monica, Calif. Search warrant in hand, they pounded on the door. A helicopter thrummed above.

title: Berkshire Hathaway Reports Third-Quarter Loss
description: Berkshire Hathaway, the conglomerate run by Warren E. Buffett, swung to a $2.6 billion loss in the third quarter, as paper losses on its vast investment portfolio and higher costs tied to weather disasters, inflation and more weighed on the company.

title: Astronomers Find a Black Hole in Our Cosmic Back Yard
description: Almost but not quite in time for Halloween, astronomers announced on Friday that they had discovered the closest known black hole. It is a biggie, a shell of yawning emptiness 10 times as massive as the sun, orbiting as far from its own star as the Earth is from ours.

title: Not everyone gets Fettermans reference to a Steelers legend in a resurfaced ad.
description: PITTSBURGH  An injured-looking John Fetterman slumps along a wall. A young boy in a Pittsburgh Steelers jersey asks if he needs help.

title: Far Rights Rise in Israel Driven by Anxiety and Fear
description: LOD, Israel  The sectarian unrest between Arabs and Jews that swept across Israeli cities in May 2021 helped end Benjamin Netanyahus last term in office. Seventeen months later, fallout from that same unrest has helped put him back in power  at the head of one of the most right-wing coalitions Israel has ever known.

title: John Hancock and Samuel Adams Are Still Fighting for the Nations Soul
description: Second only to how much this countrys founders accomplished in two decades  no set of colonies had ever liberated itself, nor since Rome had anyone designed a republic that could endure  was how much the founders quarreled among themselves.

title: The Unruly Heirs of Sarah Palin
description: Whether for her pathbreaking role as the first woman on a Republican presidential ticket or for rapping Baby Got Back on The Masked Singer, Sarah Palin has, since her debut on the national scene in 2008, made an art of attracting the spotlight.

title: I Write About Post-Roe America Every Day. Its Worse Than You Think.
description: Despite Republican assurances that their draconian abortion bans wouldnt hurt women, a flood of heart-wrenching accounts from across the country prove otherwise. Yet even with that outpouring of stories, plus polls showing broad opposition to the bans and an increase in women registering to vote, its still unclear if the issue will be the deciding factor for voters in the midterm elections on Tuesday.

title: King Oil Reigns Over American Politics
description: President Biden knows the political power of the price of gasoline.

title: This Perfect Mother-Daughter Read Holds a Powerful Lesson for Fighting Antisemitism
description: Like many book nerds, when I became a mother I fantasized about a future in which my daughters and I could lounge side by side, reading in comfortable silence. I was overjoyed when this started happening with my older daughter  we started reading together and shed chatter about the characters in the books that she was tearing through, like the telepathic elves in the Keeper of the Lost Cities series.

title: Freddy Rodrguez, 76, Artist Who Explored His Dominican Roots, Dies
description: Freddy Rodrguez, an artist who explored colonization, immigration and other aspects of his Dominican heritage, finding success in the United States at a time when artists of Latin American background struggled for mainstream attention, died on Oct. 10 in Queens. He was 76.

title: We Need to Be Clear About Who Pushed Us to the Breaking Point
description: On Wednesday, President Biden gave a second speech on the threat to democracy. It was a little less dramatic than his Philadelphia speech on the same subject, and it was more focused as well. He spent his time on the threat, rather than touch on his infrastructure bill or speak to economic growth under his administration.

title: Is Use of the Death Penalty Ever Moral?
description: To the Editor:

title: Catching Up With the Next Leader of the New York City Marathon
description: Rob Simmelkjaers career has touched numerous segments of the sports business, from the top echelons of management at ESPN, to on-air stints at the Olympics for NBC, to running sports-gaming policy in Connecticut in his capacity as the director of the states lottery.

title: Tornadoes Touch Down in Northeast Texas
description: Tornadoes tore through parts of Texas, Arkansas and Oklahoma, damaging dozens of homes and leaving thousands of people without power, according to officials.

title: How Republicans Fed a Misinformation Loop About the Pelosi Attack
description: Within hours of the brutal attack last week on Paul Pelosi, Republican officials and media figures began circulating groundless claims  nearly all of them sinister, and many homophobic  about what had happened.

title: Samuel L. Katz, a Developer of the Measles Vaccine, Dies at 95
description: Dr. Samuel L. Katz, a virologist who was part of the research team at Harvard Medical School that developed the measles vaccine, an advance more than half a century ago that has saved countless lives, died on Monday at his home in Chapel Hill, N.C. He was 95.

title: At Least 38 Injured in High-Rise Fire in Manhattan
description: Firefighters, using ropes and dangling off a high-rise in Midtown Manhattan, rescued a woman who was trapped in a fire that injured at least 38 people on Saturday, officials said.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Sues Pennsylvania Election Officials to Accept Undated Mail Ballots
description: The N.A.A.C.P. and several other voting rights groups sued Pennsylvania election officials on Friday in federal court as part of an 11th-hour effort to get them to accept mail-in ballots that are received on time but are not properly dated.

title: In Arizona, Kari Lake Worked in Local TV News. Now, She Calls Reporters Monsters.
description: One longtime former co-worker in the television news business recalled that Kari Lake detested guns and practiced Buddhism. Another former local news anchor, Stephanie Angelo, who did not work with Ms. Lake but later became close friends with her, described Ms. Lake back then as a free spirit and liberal to the core.

title: Dozens Injured in New York City Apartment Fire
description: Nearly 40 people were injured in a high-rise apartment fire in Midtown Manhattan, officials said. Videos shared by residents of the building show smoke billowing from the windows.

title: At Least One Dead After Tornadoes Lash Oklahoma
description: At least one person was killed and at least 10 others were injured after tornadoes struck Arkansas, Oklahoma and Texas on Friday night, officials said.

title: At Fetterman Rally, Obama Mocks Oz and Tells Crowd to Vote for Democracy
description: PITTSBURGH  Former President Barack Obama, campaigning for the first time with Lt. Gov. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania, urged Democratic supporters on Saturday to vote to save democracy and abortion rights. Mr. Obama also mocked Dr. Mehmet Oz, the Republican in the Senate race, as a television pitchman with no interest in helping working people.

title: In 2022, Reality Has a Conservative Bias
description: Reality, Stephen Colbert remarked at the White House Correspondents Dinner in 2006, has a well-known liberal bias. That was back when he played a caricature of a conservative instead of a caricature of a liberal (I assume thats the point of his current late-night role, at least), and the line rolled out brilliantly into the midst of a decade where reality was delivering some punishing blows to the Republican Partys theories of the world.

title: White House Clarifies Bidens Coal Remarks After Outrage From Manchin
description: PHILADELPHIA  President Biden came under fire from a crucial member of his own party, Senator Joe Manchin III, Democrat of West Virginia, on Saturday after making comments that suggested coal plants in the United States would be shuttered as the nation shifts to solar and wind power.

title: LeBron James and Deni Avdija React to Kyrie Irving Posts
description: The Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James and Deni Avdija, a Washington Wizards forward from Israel, said Friday that they hoped Nets guard Kyrie Irving understood that he had hurt people when he promoted an antisemitic film on social media.

title: Doris Grumbach, Author Who Explored Womens Plight, Dies at 104
description: Doris Grumbach, who in novels, essays and literary criticism explored the social and psychic hardships of women trapped in repressive families or disintegrating marriages, and who, as modern feminism came of age in the 1970s and 80s, portrayed lesbian characters and themes in a positive light that was then unusual in mainstream fiction, died on Friday in Kennett Square, Pa. She was 104.

title: N.H.L. Commissioner Says Player Who Racially Abused a Classmate Is Ineligible
description: The Boston Bruins are facing a backlash for their decision to sign Mitchell Miller, a 20-year-old defenseman who admitted in court to bullying a fellow student while using racist language.

title: Romano Mazzoli, Who Oversaw Major Immigration Reform, Dies at 89
description: Romano L. Mazzoli, the son of an Italian immigrant who as a Democratic representative from Kentucky teamed up with a conservative senator from Wyoming to champion the last major attempt at comprehensive immigration reform, died on Tuesday at his home in Louisville, Ky. He was 89.

title: Kyiv Planning for Total Evacuation if It Loses Electricity
description: KYIV, Ukraine  As they struggle to maintain an electricity grid heavily damaged by Russian missiles, officials in the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, say they have begun planning for a once unthinkable possibility: a complete blackout that would require the evacuation of the citys approximately three million remaining residents.

title: Length-ening
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Michael Lieberman lives in Washington, D.C., and is a lawyer at a consumer-protection firm. This is his ninth New York Times crossword, and his second Sunday grid, in two years. His inspiration came when the title of the Billy Joel song We Didnt Start the Fire morphed into ennui didnt start the fire, which didnt make much sense but did make him laugh. He went searching for other such transformations that could be used to build a puzzle.

title: G.O.P. Begins Ballot Watching Push Ahead of Election Day
description: NORTH LAS VEGAS, Nev.  The questions began soon after the doors opened to the public at a sprawling elections office inside a warehouse, and they kept coming until the sky was dark and a cold wind was blowing outside. Hundreds of thousands of ballots for Clark County, which encompasses Las Vegas, are processed, sorted and counted here, against a backdrop of mountains and desert.

title: Aaron Carter, Singer and Onetime Teenage Sensation, Dies at 34
description: Aaron Carter, the singer and actor who briefly became a teenage sensation in the early 2000s and who was known for the hit song I Want Candy, was found dead on Saturday at his home in Southern California. He was 34.

title: Democrats express concern about threats and violence in the Pennsylvania county where Trump is holding his rally.
description: Democratic officials in Westmoreland County, Pa., where former President Donald J. Trump is speaking on Saturday, said they had seen an uptick in disturbing incidents targeting Democrats in the past year.

title: Twitter Begins Offering $7.99-a-Month Verification Subscriptions
description: Twitter announced on Saturday that it would begin charging customers $7.99 a month to receive a verification check mark on their profiles, one of a raft of product changes that the company has been discussing since Elon Musks takeover a little over a week ago.

title: Biden emphasizes the threat to Social Security and Medicare at rally in Philadelphia.
description: PHILADELPHIA  President Biden doubled down on Saturday on his warning that Republicans will try to roll back Social Security and Medicare benefits if they win control of Congress next week, making the election a referendum on Americas safety net programs.

title: Heres a Curveball: What About Pressly for Series M.V.P.?
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Houston Astros have recorded 135 outs this World Series. In the span of 24 pitches Thursday night, the four most pivotal were thrown by the same man.

title: In Georgia, Could a Football Win Help Walker Win as Well?
description: Herschel Walkers Senate campaign has had several tailwinds working for it this year: President Bidens unpopularity and steady inflation top the list.

title: Dow Finsterwald, Golfer Known for Some Close Calls, Dies at 93
description: Dow Finsterwald, who captured the 1958 P.G.A. Championship and twice narrowly missed out on winning the Masters while becoming one of golfs most consistent money winners, died Nov. 4 at his home in Colorado Springs. He was 93.

title: Flightline Romps at the Breeders Cup, Building His Legend
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  No one was coming for Flightline, and Flavien Prat knew it. He looked over his shoulder on the far turn.

title: The Architect of the Astros Is Gone. His Imprint Remains.
description: HOUSTON  The finish line for the World Series is Minute Maid Park, where the Houston Astros have celebrated pennants and raised a championship banner. It is also where they once operated a sign-stealing scheme that, for some, will always cast suspicion on their enduring supremacy.

title: The New York City Marathon by the Numbers
description: Here's a look at some numbers behind the New York City Marathon.

title: Los Angeles F.C. Wins First Title on Dramatic Days Final Twist
description: It had taken the finest of margins to separate Los Angeles F.C. and the Philadelphia Union on the final day of Major League Soccers regular season, months and months of work all coming down to a tiebreaker to decide the leagues best record. So, it was to be expected, then, that it would take the finest of margins to separate them again when the leagues two best teams met, perhaps inevitably, in Saturdays M.L.S. Cup final.

title: Walker and Warnock Spend Big on TV Ads as Georgia Football Wins
description: Nothing quite holds an audience captive like a clash of undefeated college football behemoths. Senator Raphael Warnock and Herschel Walker didnt need reminding of that on Saturday.

title: Obama, acknowledging pocketbook issues, urges voters not to overlook threats to democracy.
description: PHILADELPHIA  Former President Barack Obama on Saturday issued a stark warning about threats to American democracy, even as he acknowledged that many voters were consumed by a range of other urgent issues in the final stretch of the midterm campaign.

title: Corrections: Nov. 6, 2022
description: An article on Page 17 this weekend about some  favorite holiday movies of a select few celebrities misspells the surname of an actor. He is Macaulay Culkin, not Caulkin. The article also misspelled the name of a character in How the Grinch Stole Christmas. She is Cindy Lou Who, not Cindy Lou Hoo.

title: An Unimpeachable Championship: Houston Astros Win World Series
description: HOUSTON  For years, wherever the Houston Astros traveled, they felt the fury behind the booing and jeers from opposing fans, and withstood charges that their 2017 World Series championship was tainted by allegations of cheating.

title: Quotation of the Day: Pop Culture and Politics Propel Surging Stream of Antisemitism
description: When systems fail, whether its the government or the markets or anything else, leaders often look for someone to blame. Jews have historically played that role.

title: Southeast Asia is a case study in Russias declining prospects as an arms exporter.
description: Arms sales have long been an important part of Russian foreign policy. But those sales were declining before the invasion of Ukraine, and analysts say that the war will probably hasten the trend.

title: On S.N.L., President Biden Has Two Words on the Midterms: Big Yikes
description: On the weekend before the 2022 midterm elections, Saturday Night Live turned to James Austin Johnson, its resident impersonator of President Biden, to assess how Democratic candidates might fare at the polls. And, well, he wanted to make a lot of last-minute substitutions.

title: Phillies Take Solace in This Being the Beginning of Their Story
description: HOUSTON  Their season ended in a blizzard of strikeouts, iced by the best pitching staff, statistically, in the American League and, arguably, in all of baseball.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: SUNDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Currencies, Costs and Confetti Cake
description: A few weeks ago, the British pound went on a wild ride.

title: A Man Came in to the Store Looking for a Hard-to-Find Style
description: Dear Diary:

title: Oz Could Be the First Muslim U.S. Senator, but Some Muslim Americans Are Ambivalent
description: In just a few days, Pennsylvania could elect Dr. Mehmet Oz to the Senate, which would make him the nations first Muslim senator.

title: Abrupt New Border Expulsions Split Venezuelan Families
Smoking and Gambling Go Hand in Hand. But Maybe Not for Long.
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J.  Len Lombardo, 74 and retired, rests his cigarette against a black plastic ashtray as he pushes a $5 button on a high-limit slot machine at the Resorts Casino Hotel in Atlantic City, N.J. Nearby, a 62-year-old Pennsylvania woman on a winning streak takes a drag from a Newport, as does her sister sitting at the machine to her right.

title: Ronald Lauder: New Yorks Billionaire Political Disrupter
description: Ronald S. Lauder, a 78-year-old cosmetics heir, philanthropist and art collector who is among the richest men in New York, has become the most prolific state political donor in memory this fall, fueling a Republicans surging candidacy for governor in one of the countrys most liberal states.

title: What Lupita Nyongo and Eric Adams Wore to the Party
description: It was a week of beginnings. The new David Geffen Hall at Lincoln Center held an opening night gala on Oct. 26 with a lively concert that featured Alicia Keys, Rene Fleming, Vanessa Williams and the New York Philharmonic. Mayor Eric Adams gave opening remarks at the cocktail reception, which was followed by a dinner that took over two tiers.

title: Houstons Veteran Rookie Wins World Series M.V.P.
description: HOUSTON  Where would the Houston Astros be without Jeremy Pea?

title: Fact-Checking the Misleading Claim About 87,000 Tax Agents
description: As the midterm campaigns come to a close, Republican lawmakers are seizing on misleading claims warning that Democrats are recruiting an army of tax auditors, finding new resonance in an assertion debunked months ago.

title: Yuval Noah Harari Unspools the Story of Human History  for Kids
description: Where are you from?

title: A Key Polling Warning Sign Has Dimmed Since September
description: Way back in September, we noticed a warning sign in the polls: Democrats were showing strength in exactly the places where the polls overestimated their chances in 2020.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Who Are All Those Celebrities at the Weird Al Pool Party? A Guide
description: Heres how Weird Al Yankovic, the accordion-playing king of parody, would like you to think Another One Rides the Bus was written: At a pool party, the radio personality Wolfman Jack challenged him to devise a sendup of Queens Another One Bites the Dust on the spot.

title: Macys Plans to Invest Millions to Fund Minority-Owned Businesses
description: Robin Wilson has experienced plenty of success since starting her home textile business, Clean Design Home, in 2000. Her hypoallergenic products have been sold at Bed Bath & Beyond, and she has fulfilled large orders for a hotel chain. Her wares are also available at 50 Macys locations across the United States, which has resulted in millions of dollars worth of sales.

title: Developing Nations Have a Message at Global Climate Talks: Polluters, Pay Up
description: In Pakistan, flooding this summer killed 1,700 people and left one-third of the country underwater. In Fiji, entire villages are retreating inland to escape rising seas.  In Kenya, persistent drought has killed livestock and devastated livelihoods.

title: His Roman Holiday Lasted a Lifetime
description: If Paris is a moveable feast, as Hemingway would tell every college junior on a gap year, then Rome is a stately banquet at which guests linger perhaps longer than they intended. The photographer, critic and salonist Milton Gendel was one. He arrived there on a Fulbright scholarship at 30, and more or less stayed for almost 70 more years.

title: Russia Reactivates Its Trolls and Bots Ahead of Tuesdays Midterms
description: Follow our live coverage of the 2022 midterm elections for the latest news and updates.

title: Could India Help Broker Peace in Ukraine?
description: In July, when a critical deal was brokered by the United Nations and Turkey to free up millions of pounds of desperately needed Ukrainian grain, India played an important behind-the-scenes role in helping sell the plan to Russia, which had been blockading the grain ships.

title: How Molly Jong-Fast Tweeted Her Way to Liberal Media Stardom
description: Molly Jong-Fast had just finished interviewing Vice President Kamala Harris for her podcast when she hopped in an Uber S.U.V. headed to the Century, the Manhattan literary club where she was throwing a book party for the media critic Margaret Sullivan, a friend. The editors of Rolling Stone and Vanity Fair greeted her with hugs. The owner of The New Republic, Win McCormack, stopped to say hello.

title: Big Tobacco Heralds a Healthier World While Fighting Its Arrival
description: For decades, public health advocates chipped away at the influence of Big Tobacco with measures aimed at discouraging cigarette use. But the bitter legal and political battles were just a prelude to the unfolding climactic clash that could determine the fate of smoking and whether these companies adapt or falter.

title: Somalis Are Going Hungry. Their Government Isnt Calling It a Famine.
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A severely malnourished child is admitted to a clinic in Somalia on average every minute of every day. With crops and animals decimated in the worst drought to blanket the nation in four decades, millions of Somalis stand on the brink of starvation in an unprecedented humanitarian catastrophe.

title: Winding Down With LaKeith Stanfield
description: LaKeith Stanfield was settling into his hotel in Atlanta at around 10 p.m. Hed just wrapped a full day of filming for his upcoming movie Haunted Mansion, set to release next summer.

title: What Happens When Crypto Meets Ted Lasso
description: Preston Johnson, a soft-spoken cryptocurrency millionaire with a long, bushy, brown beard, leaned forward in his seat, fists clenched, surveying his empire. He wasnt perched on a mega yacht or enjoying any of the other ostentatious perks of crypto wealth. The setting was humbler: a small soccer stadium in a town about 30 miles south of London, where the lowest-ranked team in Englands professional leagues was battling for survival.

title: Can Republicans and Democrats Find a Way Forward on Immigration?
description: WASHINGTON  A drug needle goes into a persons arm; an adult and child walk through a graveyard; and footage of migrants walking along a sandy stretch of a border wall, in Yuma, Arizona, streams while ominous music plays in the background of this video.

title: In Affluent Greenwich, Its Republicans vs. Trumplicans
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: A Legend Finally Gets His Moment
description: HOUSTON  For all of Darren Bakers life, his father had chased a championship. That was Dusty Bakers job, from San Francisco to Chicago to Cincinnati to Washington to Houston, and he always did it quite well. He just never got the ending right.

title: Republicans Are Doubling Down on Trumpism. Its Going to Work.
description: If Republicans have many things going for them in next weeks elections  an economy thats like a millstone around Democrats necks, fear in the electorate about crime and a chaotic immigration system, President Bidens low approval ratings  they are also taking what appear to be some enormous risks: having candidates on the ballot seen by many as too inexperienced, extreme or scandal burdened to win their races.

title: White Lotus and the Plight of the American Man
description: What the hell happened to the great American man? How did he go from swashbuckling hero of his own story to tragicomic villain in everyone elses? One minute, hes Superman, Steve McQueen, Sylvester Stallone. The next, he is everything wrong with America.

title: Republicans Have Made It Very Clear What They Want to Do if They Win Congress
description: What Republicans are offering, if they win the 2022 elections, is not conservatism. It is crisis. More accurately, it is crises. A debt-ceiling crisis. An election crisis. And a body blow to the governments efforts to prepare for a slew of other crises we know are coming.

title: Why the F.B.I. Is So Far Behind on Cybercrime
description: There are many factors behind the stunning rise of ransomware. Our reporting found that one of the most important is the Federal Bureau of Investigations outmoded approach to computer crime targeting people and institutions in the United States.

title: The Sunday Read: Taken Under Fascism, Spains Stolen Babies Are Learning the Truth
description: The phenomenon of babies stolen from hospitals in Spain, once shrouded in secrecy, is now being spoken about.

title: Democrats, Dont Despair. There Are Bright Spots for Our Party.
description: The Democratic Party and Senator Mitch McConnell rarely see eye to eye on anything. But if Democrats hold the line in the elections on Tuesday and keep control of the Senate  and we still have a shot  it will come down to candidate quality.

title: The Week in Business: The Fed Stays Its Course
description: When the Federal Reserve raised interest rates another three-quarters of a point on Wednesday, the fourth-consecutive increase of that size, the central bank sent mixed messages about its path. The policy statement accompanying the rate decision emphasized that officials would soon slow down the increases. But Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, seemed to communicate the opposite, saying at a news conference that it was premature to think about pausing the Feds aggressive campaign to tame inflation. Investors liked one of these messages more than the other: The policy memo briefly pushed up stocks on Wall Street; Mr. Powells comments sent them falling. Fed officials have expressed concern about doing too little to fight inflation, but they are also acutely aware of the risks of doing too much. On Wednesday, Mr. Powell acknowledged that the window for a so-called soft landing that would avoid tipping the economy into a recession had narrowed.

title: Whats at Stake
description: To understand the importance and consequences of Tuesdays midterm elections, I spoke to Astead Herndon, a political reporter who has been covering this election cycle for the Times podcast The Run-Up.

title: Why Ashton Kutcher is running his first, and maybe last, marathon.
description: For Ashton Kutchers first marathon  and perhaps his last  there was only one choice: New York City.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Nov. 7, 2022
description: 1. After looking closely at the image above (or at the full-size image), think about these three questions:

title: Taiwans Bomb Shelters: A Space for Life. And a Space for Death.
description: KEELUNG, Taiwan  Visitors to Keelung, a mountainous port city on Taiwans northern coast, might reasonably think that the white wall at the back of Shi Hui-huas breakfast shop is, well, a wall. Only a few air vents suggest that there might be something on the other side.

title: Myra Melford Builds Anew With an All-Star, All-Woman Quintet
description: Draft up a list of todays most inventive and respected players in the realm of what tends to be called improvised music (or creative music or free jazz) and youll inevitably name the players in the pianist Myra Melfords Fire and Water Quintet: the saxophonist Ingrid Laubrock, the guitarist Mary Halvorson, the cellist Tomeka Reid and the percussionist Lesley Mok.

title: The Case for Hibernating During Winter
description: As the days shorten and the dark hours stretch, every impulse in me is to slow down, get under a blanket and stay there till spring. In a 2020 piece for The Atlantic exploring the possibility of human hibernation, James Hamblin wrote that as the winter months come upon us, Maybe our minds and bodies are telling us were not supposed to be fighting so hard. As the New York winter hardened, he resolved: It is absolutely ridiculous that we dont hibernate. Hamblin makes clear that we cant actually hibernate all winter long, though short periods of human hibernation are theoretically possible and could be useful for certain medical treatments. Still, his basic point is spot on.

title: Marcel Hug and Susannah Scaroni win the wheelchair races in record fashion.
description: Marcel Hug of Switzerland won his fifth New York City Marathon mens wheelchair title by shattering the course record convincingly, while Susannah Scaroni of the United States grabbed her first title in the womens division and also set a course record.

title: Here are the celebrities running this years marathon.
description: Among the delights of the New York City Marathon is its democratizing effect, as New Yorkers and far-flung visitors run alongside professional athletes and celebrities.

title: In Final Push for Votes, Both Parties Court Black Men
description: Jonathan Williamson comes from a long line of Georgia Democrats. Growing up, his parents voted Democrat, his grandmother voted Democrat. So did most of his friends and neighbors. And for a while, Mr. Williamson did, too.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. I love Kay Chuns tofu and cabbage stir-fry with basil (above), a subtle recipe with a nice mustardy kick. But what I want for dinner is a punchy, freestyled variation on that dish with bacon in place of the basil, and a sauce of oyster and soy sauces, water, cornstarch and a sprinkle of sugar.

title: Police Remove Bicyclist From the Marathon Course
description: As the elite runner Daniel do Nascimento crossed the Queensboro Bridge, New York City Police pulled a man with a backpack on a bicycle off the course.

title: Ela Bhatt, Advocate for Women Workers in India, Dies at 89
description: NEW DELHI  Ela Bhatt, a champion of gender justice and equality who secured protections for millions of Indian women in the work force and helped them become self-reliant, died on Nov. 2 in Ahmedabad, India. She was 89.

title: Climate Conference to Debate Whether Rich Nations Will Pay for Damage
description: Follow our live coverage of the COP27 Climate Summit in Egypt.

title: A Climate Change Skeptics Change of Heart
description: To the Editor:

title: Confidence, Anxiety and a Scramble for Votes Two Days Before the Midterms
description: The turbulent midterm campaign rolled through its final weekend on Sunday as voters  buffeted by record inflation, worries about their personal safety and fears about the fundamental stability of American democracy  showed clear signs of preparing to reject Democratic control of Washington and embrace divided government.

title: What is the prize money for the New York City Marathon?
description: Theres a lot of prize money to be doled out to this years New York City Marathon winners.

title: Russian state media confirms that a top general is no longer in his post.
description: The senior Russian military commander who was publicly bashed by a close ally of President Vladimir V. Putin over his performance in Ukraine is no longer in his post, according to Russian state media, in what appeared to be the latest in a string of personnel shake-ups as Moscow grapples with open criticism of its setbacks on the battlefield.

title: Indigenous Voters, Gaining Influence, Look to Mobilize
description: ANCHORAGE  Tesla Coxs eyes filled with tears as she thought about watching her state elect its first Alaska Native to Congress this year, and what it could mean for the future.

title: N.Y.C. Marathon Runners Helped Off the Course After Collapsing
description: Runners in the New York City Marathon endured unseasonably warm weather, with temperatures in the mid-70s.

title: How to Run the New York City Marathon
description: Youve watched the New York City Marathon runners. Maybe you know some. Maybe you want to join the party and run the marathon yourself next year. So how do you get to be one of the 50,000 runners lining up on the Verrazzano-Narrows Bridge in 2023?

title: Michael Basman, Chess Master Known for Bad Openings, Dies at 76
description: Michael Basman, an English international chess master who was known for playing some of the most irregular and least respected openings  often with success  died on Oct. 26 in Carshalton, a suburb of London. He was 76.

title: Runners and Spectators Celebrate the New York City Marathon
description: Crowds cheered on more than 50,000 runners racing through all five boroughs of New York.

title: As Midterms Near, Biden Faces a Nation as Polarized as Ever
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M.  Before heading into a community center for a campaign rally the other day, President Biden stopped to speak to the overflow crowd that could not squeeze into the small facility.

title: Twitter Is Said to Delay Changes to Check Mark Badges Until After Midterms
description: Twitter is delaying the rollout of verification check marks to subscribers of its new $7.99 a month subscription service until after Tuesdays midterm elections, according to an internal post viewed by The New York Times and two people with knowledge of the decision.

title: How Fast Celebrities Ran the 2022 New York City Marathon
description: Once again, the New York City Marathon offered ordinary runners a rare opportunity: a chance to measure up to (and perhaps beat) celebrity runners like the actor Ashton Kutcher or former New York Giants running back Tiki Barber.

title: Brooklyn Couple Throws 35th Annual Marathon Block Party
description: The couple served breakfast and hired a D.J. to work the crowd and cheer on the runners.

title: Dancing Near the Edge of a Lost Democracy
description: One of the most sobering statements from President Bidens speech last week on protecting democracy was one that might well have gone unnoticed by many who heard it or read about it.

title: At 11th-Hour Rally, Biden Pushes for Hochul in Crucial N.Y. Election
description: Leaning on presidents past and present, Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York barnstormed around the New York City area this weekend, furiously trying to stave off a major upset by focusing on areas where high Democratic voter turnout will be crucial for her chances.

title: Your Monday Briefing: COP27 Begins
description: The 27th annual U.N. climate talks, known as COP27, began yesterday. At the top of the agenda for developing countries is financing for loss and damage: Who will pay for the costs of a warming world?

title: Trump May Pose a Test No Special Counsel Can Pass
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Merrick B. Garland has long said that the Justice Department is up to the task of investigating former President Donald J. Trump, whose final weeks in office included his supporters attacking the Capitol as he refused to acknowledge his election loss.

title: Two Weeks From World Cup, U.S. Star Counts the Minutes
description: Follow live coverage of Mexico vs. Argentina and the latest World Cup standings.

title: Reality of Irvings Import to Nike: They Can Drop Him
description: Nike is facing plenty of challenges this year.

title: The New York City Marathon: A 26.2-Mile Fashion Show
description: Before 50,000 runners are unleashed onto the streets of New York, they congregate in Fort Wadsworth on Staten Island and face an hourslong wait. In those early hours, marathon runners linger, grapple with pre-race jitters and admire what others are wearing.

title: Russia Looks to Private Militia to Secure a Victory in Eastern Ukraine
description: After weeks of unexpected battlefield setbacks for Russia, the war in Ukraine on Sunday delivered another surprise: the emergence of a former Russian convict and onetime hot-dog seller as perhaps the Kremlins best hope for a small, face-saving military victory.

title: Meta Is Said to Plan Significant Job Cuts This Week
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Meta plans to lay off employees this week, three people with knowledge of the situation said, adding that the job cuts were set to be the most significant at the company since it was founded in 2004.

title: What We Learned From Week 9 in the N.F.L.
description: The power atop the A.F.C. has constantly shifted among 10 or so playoff-quality teams fighting for just seven spots, but each week the Buffalo Bills have made the most consistent case of being worthy of a top seed. That changed on Sunday with an eyebrow-raising 20-17 loss to the Jets in which Josh Allens options were decidedly earthbound.

title: Now It Makes Sense!
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Happy Monday, solvers, and welcome to a new week of New York Times Crossword puzzles! Todays offering comes from Jill Singer, a debut constructor whose theme is sure to make you smile at the weird ways humans use metaphors to express emotions.

title: Amazon Considers Disclaimer to Antisemitic Film Irving Shared Online
description: The Brooklyn Nets and the Anti-Defamation League sent a letter to Amazon asking the company to address the deeply and unequivocally antisemitic documentary and related book at the heart of the Brooklyn Nets guard Kyrie Irvings suspension. The company said it was working with the A.D.L. to explore adding a disclaimer to the film.

title: For Fetterman, Campaign Trail Doubles as Road to Recovery
description: COLLEGEVILLE, Pa.  John Fetterman was getting fired up at a campaign rally on Thursday evening, vigorously bashing his Republican opponent, Mehmet Oz, as a fraud, when the lingering effects of the stroke he had in May abruptly surfaced.

title: Jets Turn Up the Pressure on the Bills in the A.F.C. East With a Win
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  This season, the Buffalo Bills had gone on the road and defeated the Los Angeles Rams, the defending Super Bowl champions; the Baltimore Ravens, led by a former league most valuable player; and Kansas City, the team responsible for ending the Bills 2021 season in heartbreaking fashion in the divisional round of the playoffs.

title: Review: You Will Get Sick Tells the Untellable, for a Price
description: Disease, dying and death are usually depicted as wretched or bloody onstage. Were meant to cry or recoil.

title: Trump-DeSantis Rift Grows, With Dueling Rallies in Florida
description: SUN CITY CENTER, Fla.  Former President Donald J. Trump hasnt endorsed Gov. Ron DeSantis this year because, as he has explained, his fellow Floridian never asked. Mr. DeSantis didnt attend the Trump rally on Sunday in Miami, his allies said, because he wasnt personally invited.

title: Apple Could Be Short of iPhones Because of Factory Disruptions in China
description: Weeks after expressing optimism about the global economy and its business, Apple on Sunday warned that its sales would fall short of expectations because a key iPhone factory in China had been shut down by a coronavirus outbreak.

title: Your Pies Have Arrived
description: Apple, pecan, pumpkin, lemon meringue: Theyre all here, as youve never seen them before.

title: What to Know About Irvings Antisemitic Movie Post and the Fallout
description: Nets guard Kyrie Irving continues to face backlash for posting a link on Twitter to an antisemitic film last month.

title: Can North Carolina Finish the Job? Or Will the Big Ten Break Through?
description: More than seven months after Kansas stormed back from a 15-point halftime deficit to beat North Carolina in the Division I mens basketball championship game, a new season will begin Monday night.

title: South Carolina and Stanford Headline Talent at the Top
description: A new womens college basketball season will tip off on Monday, and the same teams that dominated the last two campaigns will be favored to do so again.

title: No Corrections: Nov. 7, 2022
description: Errors are corrected during the press run whenever possible, so some errors noted here may not have appeared in all editions.

title: Quotation of the Day: Indigenous Voters, Gaining Influence, Aim to Mobilize
description: Our next steps are not just getting our people to go and vote, but getting our people to be the people that people vote for.

title: Next to Lambeau Field, a Place Where Cheeseheads Come Together
description: In Titletown, games of catch have an open invite.

title: Even as Challenges Mount, Europeans Stick by Ukraine
description: ROME  The high cost of living is provoking strikes, protests and widespread grumbling. Talk about nuclear weapons has heightened anxieties and encouraged some to demand rapid negotiations. And President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is wooing politicians, including many from populist parties on the right and the left who have flirted with him in the past.

title: It Took Two Weeks to Call Every State in 2020. This Is When to Expect Results This Year.
description: We surveyed every state about their plans for counting votes in the 2022 election.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Developing countries face irreversible damage from climate change but have done little to cause the crisis. And they are demanding compensation from the parties they see as responsible: wealthier nations that have emitted half of all heat-trapping gases since 1850 and created pollution that is dangerously heating the planet.

title: Whats on TV This Week: Atlanta and Black Panther
description: Between network, cable and streaming, the modern television landscape is a vast one. Here are some of the shows, specials and movies coming to TV this week, Nov. 7-13. Details and times are subject to change.

title: Israels New Kingmaker Is a Dangerous Extremist, and Hes Here to Stay
description: Late Tuesday night in Jerusalem, Itamar Ben-Gvir, the leader of the far-right Jewish Power Party, stood onstage triumphant before a raucous, ecstatic crowd. His supporters chanted, Look who it is, the next prime minister! as trance beats blared in the background. Mr. Ben-Gvir, in fact, had not been elected prime minister, but he will have played an instrumental role in returning Benjamin Netanyahu to power.

title: Whats at Stake in These Elections
description: Midterm elections in the United States are often presented as a referendum on the party in power, and that message appears to be resonating this fall. But voters need to consider the intentions of the party that hopes to regain power, too, and what each vote they cast will mean for the future of this country.

title: A History of Doo-Wop Emerges From Sandy Wreckage
description: Good morning. Its Monday. Hurricane Sandy did billions of dollars worth of damage, but it didnt destroy everything in its path. Well find out about a documentary that exists because Sandy didnt ruin the raw footage. And well take a last look at the campaigns and the candidates.

title: Word of the Day: poignant
description: The word poignant has appeared in 411 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Sept. 23 in What We Will Miss Most About Roger Federer by Michael Steinberger:

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: MONDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Race Question in Supreme Court Adoption Case Unnerves Tribes
description: The little girl who will soon be known by the nine justices of the United States Supreme Court as Y.R.J. is now 4 years old. For much of her short life she has been living with Dr. Jennifer Brackeen and Chad Brackeen, a suburban Texas couple fighting with the Navajo Nation to adopt her. Y.R.J.s birth mother is Navajo. The Brackeens are white.

title: A Messy Marital Split Tarnishes a Roman Soccer Legend
description: ROME  Once upon a time, Francesco Totti, the crowned prince of Italian soccer, celebrated a goal by ripping off his jersey and revealing a T-shirt reading, Youre the One, a proclamation of eternal love for Ilary Blasi, a showgirl who stole his heart. The two got married on live television, had three children and moved into a villa befitting Romes born-and-bred royal family.

title: Michael Bloomberg announces a new initiative to phase out coal in 25 countries.
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  Michael Bloomberg, the former mayor of New York City and now a special envoy on climate change for the United Nations, announced a new international plan on Monday to help 25 countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America phase out coal by 2040.

title: 40 Chickens in 40 Days: How a Philadelphia Man Cheered His City
description: There was no confetti strewn across the streets of Philadelphia on Sunday morning, no chants of We are the champions, or whiffs of smoke from celebratory fireworks. The city had lost both the World Series and the Major League Soccer Cup final on Saturday in a span of about five hours.

title: What Are Your Stories of Rebuilding After Disaster? Tell Us.
description: The era we are now in the midst of might be defined, most notably, by the omnipresence of disaster. Plagues, droughts, floods, toxic air and water, wars, massacres, famines, earthquakes, heat waves, wildfires, recessions, dust storms, despotism  slow-motion nightmares are crashing into fast-moving catastrophes, each one amplifying the next.

title: Whos attending COP27, and who isnt.
description: Who will be present at the COP27 climate conference in Sharm el Sheikh, Egypt, is as revealing as who wont be.

title: Who Will Win in These Eight Races?
description: Political experts place their bets on the midterm elections.

title: A Core Question at COP27: Who Will Pay for Climate Change?
description: At this years annual climate summit, a debate over who bears the financial responsibility for climate change, and what they owe, will be center stage.

title: What Are the Best Forever Boots?
description: Why settle for five years? Id go for 10. That is, after all, when the sustainable apparel coalition writes the environmental impact of a garment down to zero. And, like sneakers, flats and a pair of heels, boots  the everyday kind, not the rain or snow kind  are one of the basic building blocks of a footwear wardrobe. Finding the right pair can solve a myriad of dressing problems, not to mention provide some welcome ankle support. But where to begin?

title: How Do You Make Hard Decisions?
description: Should you cut your hair  or perhaps dye it? Should you finally ask that special someone out on a date? Should you join a sports team, get an after school job or perhaps run for class president? Where should you go to college, or what should you do after high school?

title: What Has Happened to My Country?
description: NASHVILLE  There I was, snug in my own bed in the middle of the night, turning to sleep on my side, when wham! the room slid sideways. Then it took off, spinning and spinning as though a sadistic carnival barker had flipped a switch and pushed the speed to max.

title: How Bad Are Things? I Asked Some Election Workers.
description: DURHAM, N.C.  One of the challenges of being alive right now is making sense of the threat to the American election system: Its hard to determine, conclusively, how widespread that threat is, how much chaos and danger were living through and what to do next.

title: Who Will Win the Battle for Congress? Four Scenarios.
description: Just about anything is still possible in this years midterm elections.

title: Home for the Holidays, With Long-Festering Issues
description: Lynn Steger Strongs first two novels, Want and Hold Still, derived their considerable power from the sense you had, reading them, of being enclosed in the mind and the fraught circumstances of her isolated protagonists.

title: Supreme Court Case on State Legislatures Could Open Litigation Floodgates
description: As the Supreme Court prepares to hear a case next month that could radically reshape how federal elections are conducted, it has received scores of friend-of-the-court briefs featuring enough strange bedfellows to fill a hotel.

title: Countries Made Bold Climate Promises Last Year. How Are They Doing?
description: Follow our live coverage of the COP27 Climate Summit in Egypt.

title: After Years in Limbo, Finding a Place of Her Own
The Woman T.S. Eliot Loved at Arms Length and Enshrined in Verse
description: T.S. Eliot was so famously reserved, so conspicuously buttoned up, that Virginia Woolf joked about him coming to lunch in a four-piece suit. And yet, a vibrant new book by Lyndall Gordon, The Hyacinth Girl, reveals the hidden ardors running beneath the surface of both his life and work.

title: More Predictions! And Some Very Mixed Feelings.
description: Gail Collins: OK, Bret  its elections week! Tell me the one outcome youre most hoping to see and the one youre most dreading.

title: Putting Writers Lives on the Reading List
description: Writing is not quite the glamour profession it used to be, the poet Amanda Gorman on the cover of Time last year notwithstanding. (Over a decade had passed since a writer was on that magazines cover, and what does being on the cover of Time mean now, anyway?) So nostalgia wafts thickly over three new picture books about authors, all of which serve as parables about creativity. That your little creator might end up making content for TikTok is a problem for another day.

title: Espionage Lite or Deal Making? Prosecutors Struggle to Draw a Line.
description: The federal trial of Thomas J. Barrack Jr., a businessman and adviser to former President Donald J. Trump, hinged on a single, deceptively simple question: What makes someone an agent of a foreign government?

title: Love Comes and Goes, but a Screenshot Is Forever
description: On a Tuesday in early October, at around 5 p.m., Robb Loeb was with his wife, Jenn, in their Atlanta home, hanging a bookshelf. Or rather, attempting to hang a bookshelf.

title: An Engine of Upward Mobility Struggles to Capture Opportunities in Tech
description: The technology industry has been a leading engine of growth for good-paying jobs in New York City over the past decade. That trend continued through the pandemic, but a new report casts doubt on how widely the tech-fueled prosperity is being shared.

title: Can the Most Hated Meal Be Redeemed? The Big Brunch Says Yes.
description: Id watched enough Sex and the City in my 20s to see how brunch could give a group of friends, and the episodic structure they lived in, a leisurely rhythm. But I was a cook  my rhythm was determined by a schedule pinned to a corkboard outside my chefs office. If it put me on brunch service, it felt like Id done something wrong: There was nothing more frivolous, tedious or hellish than brunch.

title: Bob Dylan Breaks Down 66 Classic Tunes in His New Book
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Chinas Business Elite See the Country That Let Them Thrive Slipping Away
description: For decades, Chinas business class had an unspoken contract with the Communist Party: Let us make money and well turn a blind eye to how you use your power.

title: Architects Plan a City for the Future in Ukraine, While Bombs Still Fall
description: In the final few days of February, as the Russian Army advanced toward Kyiv, Ukrainian forces blew up the Irpin bridge, ripping open its latticed metal insides so that their edges buckled and curled. A suburb of Kyiv, Irpin was the last city that the Russian Army would have had to conquer to reach the capital; the bridge provided the fastest route from the city center to the Kyiv ring road. It was the main bridge that stopped the invasion of Kyiv, says Slava Balbek, a Ukrainian architect who is volunteering as a drone operator with territorial defense forces. Its like if you cut your arm off so the rest of your body will be saved.

title: Fears and Suspicion Hang Over Voting on Cusp of Election Day
description: Voters go to the polls on Tuesday after a campaign season so filled with conspiracy theories and lies that officials worry they will undermine confidence in the election no matter how the balloting goes.

title: The Worlds Most-Visited Glaciers Could Soon Be Gone
description: Making the World Heritage List from UNESCO, the United Nations educational, scientific and cultural organization, is a kind of gold seal of approval in the tourism world. The list, which began in 1978, has more than 1,150 sites nominated by their host nations and includes tourist destinations like the Great Wall of China, the Great Barrier Reef in Australia and the Central Amazon Conservation Complex in Brazil.

title: What You Get for $1.4 Million in California
description: A 1920 bungalow in Los Angeles, a 1909 Craftsman-style house in Oakland and a two-bedroom cottage in Redondo Beach.

title: $1.4 Million Homes in California
description: In 1932, the Summer Olympic Games were held in Los Angeles, and athletes were housed in small homes constructed especially for that purpose in the View Park neighborhood. Later, the unfurnished structures were sold for $140 dollars each. This one was moved to Eagle Rock, where it served as a clubhouse for scouting troops. The sellers, who bought it in 2021, did a full renovation, installing a new kitchen and bathrooms, copper plumbing, a Nest thermostat and a tankless water heater.

title: Are Trees Talking Underground? For Scientists, Its in Dispute.
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: How Much Do You Know About Malaysia?
description: Can you find Malaysia on a map? What else do you know about this Southeast Asian nation with about 31 million people?

title: Egypts most prominent political prisoner escalates a hunger strike as the summit begins.
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  The world leaders, government negotiators, climate scientists and other dignitaries are unlikely to see his name anywhere in Sharm el Sheikh, the beach resort city hosting the COP27 summit. But Alaa Abd El Fattah, Egypts most prominent revolutionary voice and its most famous political prisoner, is making his absence felt.

title: John Fetterman and the Fight for White Working-Class Voters
description: For the Democrats to hold on to power in Washington, they have to do what President Biden did in Pennsylvania two years ago: Break the Republican Partys grip on the white working-class vote, once the core of the Democratic base.

title: Does America Vote Too Much?
description: Americans casting their ballots in tomorrows midterm elections might be voting in their 30th or 40th contest in four years. In the same amount of time, a German citizen might vote in six to eight races.

title: A Cubed, Colorful Retreat in the California Desert
description: A mile from the entrance to Californias Joshua Tree National Park, a neo-primitive structure composed of three cubes stands out from the barren desert landscape like a Modernist mirage. Constructed in the early 90s as a private family retreat, Monument House was designed by the Southern California-based architect Josh Schweitzer, best known for renovating historic homes like the Frank Lloyd Wright-designed Samuel-Novarro House in Los Angeles. Now, through the hospitality brand Homestead Modern, the five-acre estate is open for private bookings for the first time.

title: COP27 offers the Egyptian resort of Sharm el Sheikh another moment in the spotlight.
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  Most of the time, Sharm el Sheikh is best-known outside Egypt as a beach haven for tourists from northern countries in search of the sun: Germans, British and, until this year, planeloads of Ukrainians and Russians getting sunburned together along the calm waters and rich coral reefs of the Red Sea.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Will Return as Oscars Host
description: In recent years, the Academy Awards have gone with three hosts new to the job. Theyve gone with zero hosts. But in 2023, just one will be on hand, and its a veteran: Jimmy Kimmel. The late-night star, who has emceed the ceremony twice before, will be the sole host of the 95th Oscars when they air March 12 on ABC, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced Monday.

title: In the Marseille Clubs, Leather, Lam and Fur Reign Supreme
26.2 Miles Is Easy. Getting Around New York City Is Not.
description: One of Daniel Romanchuks most frequent challenges, it turns out, is at the finish line.

title: A New Push for Business to Help Pay for Climate-Change Solutions
description: As world leaders gather in Sharm el Sheikh, Egypt, for the COP27 climate conference, questions about how to deal with the potentially catastrophic effects of global warming have reached a new level of urgency. No less contentious: how to pay for solving the problem, and just how much will businesses be asked to pitch in.

title: Is Californias Fire Season Over?
description: Californias recent fire seasons have stretched unsettlingly late into the year, with devastating blazes breaking out in November and December. Tomorrow is the anniversary of the start of the Camp fire, the deadliest fire in state history.

title: Wordle Wrap-Up: Oct. 31 to Nov. 6
description: Hi Wordlers! Welcome to Wordle Wrap-Up, a reminder of which words were answers this week. For stories, stats and brain teasers, sign up for the Gameplay newsletter. For a daily reminder to play Wordle, sign up for reminders.

title: Wordle Finally Has an Editor
description: After nearly a year of speculation, it will finally be our fault if Wordle is harder. Starting Nov. 7, Wordle will have a dedicated editor, just as the Crossword, Mini and Spelling Bee do.

title: Will Rain Affect Turnout Tomorrow? The Answer Is Cloudy.
description: Where the Election Day forecast is wetter than normal.

title: Tom Brady Has Passed for 100,000 Yards. Sort Of.
description: The number that was everywhere on Sunday was large and pleasingly round. Tom Brady had surpassed 100,000 yards passing, the latest milestone in his long and storied career.

title: A Total Lunar Eclipse in Early Tuesday Skies
description: During the early hours on Tuesday, darkness will slip across the face of the moon before it turns a deep blood red. No, it isnt an Election Day omen  its one of the most eye-catching sights in the night sky.

title: Coke Is a Sponsor of the Climate Summit in Egypt. Some Activists Arent Happy.
description: The decision to include Coca-Cola as a major sponsor of this years United Nations climate summit in Sharm el Sheikh, Egypt, has angered many climate activists, who cite a recent report that says the companys production of plastics is increasing.

title: Democrats Fight to Hold Oregon House Seat After Defeat of Centrist Incumbent
description: Peter Watts, a registered Democrat and lawyer in Clackamas County, would have gladly voted this year to re-elect his longtime Democratic congressman, Representative Kurt Schrader of Oregon.

title: Make Room for Pie
