description: Perhaps I should begin with a confession of sin: Im more materialistic than I thought. I dont like to think of myself this way. My heroes all lived simply, if not in outright poverty. St. Francis, St. Clare, Dorothy Day and, well, Jesus himself. My family doesnt go on fancy vacations. I dont wear nice jewelry or drive an impressive car. So I sometimes self -righteously assume that Im immune to greed, materialism and consumerism. But then we moved into a new house.

title: Zelensky calls the fighting in Donetsk hell, a sobering view after the recapture of Kherson.
description: Russian attacks have turned the eastern Ukrainian region of Donetsk into a hell, President Volodymyr Zelensky has said, drawing attention to one of the wars most entrenched battlegrounds even as the country celebrated the recapture of the southern city of Kherson.

title: Heres what we know about the attack.
description: ISTANBUL  An explosion shook a bustling pedestrian thoroughfare in central Istanbul on Sunday, killing at least six people and wounding dozens, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said.

title: Deadly Blast Hits Pedestrian Thoroughfare in Istanbul
description: Video showing people fleeing after an explosion that killed several people and wounded dozens of others near Taksim Square, one of the citys busiest areas.

title: Paul G. Allen and the Art He Didnt Sell
description: A van Gogh landscape to die for. A sacred scene by Botticelli that puts a lump in your throat. One of Jasper Johnss stunningly subtle map paintings.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Even the best home cooks have Thanksgiving questions. Even the most confident among them, even those whove cooked the feast for years. Thats why I commend to all our World of Thanksgiving and, to those new to the game, our updated roundup of Thanksgiving recipes for beginners.

title: Samuel Folsom, 102, Who Fought the Japanese Above Guadalcanal, Dies
description: Samuel Folsom, one of the last surviving Marine fighter pilots of World War II, who engaged in aerial dogfights and shot down two Japanese bombers in the horrific struggle for the strategic island of Guadalcanal at a crucial juncture in the Pacific war, died on Saturday in Sherman Oaks, Calif. He was 102.

title: A Tenors Met Opera Debut, Long Delayed, Is Worth the Wait
description: It took a few tries for Benjamin Bernheim to make his Metropolitan Opera debut.

title: Iran and China Use Private Detectives to Spy on Dissidents in America
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Democrats See a Blueprint in Fettermans Victory in Pennsylvania
description: KITTANNING, Pa.  Did John Fetterman just show Democrats how to solve their white-working-class problem?

title: David Davis, a Force Behind Game-Changing 70s Sitcoms, Dies at 86
description: David Davis, who helped usher in a golden age of television in the 1970s as a writer and producer on the groundbreaking and slyly feminist Mary Tyler Moore Show, and as a creator of The Bob Newhart Show and Taxi, died on Nov. 4 in Los Angeles. He was 86.

title: Review: The Berlin Philharmonic Gives a Master Class at Carnegie
description: Listening to the Berlin Philharmonic over three evenings at Carnegie Hall this week, I kept thinking of what the violinist Anne-Sophie Mutter once told me. Id asked her how she rated this orchestra next to the worlds other great ensembles. It was, she answered, like comparing apples and oranges.

title: Review: A Dance for Our Times Travels to a Dark Place
description: The opening of Wakatt casts the stage in a radiant glow as a half sun fills its horizon. Is it setting or rising? Does it matter? The arresting sight offers a glimpse of warmth, a sense of hope.

title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez describes fears of violence.
description: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said she has feared for her life since becoming an elected official.

title: Paul Schrade, 97, Who Was Wounded When Robert Kennedy Was Slain, Dies
description: Paul Schrade, a prominent union official who was wounded in the fusillade of bullets that killed Senator Robert F. Kennedy in 1968, and who believed that a second gunman, in addition to the convicted assassin, Sirhan B. Sirhan, fired shots that day at the Ambassador Hotel, died on Wednesday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 97.

title: Russias War Hawks Step Up Criticism of the Military Over Kherson Withdrawal
description: Russias pro-war activists delivered over the weekend their most cutting criticism of the militarys performance in Ukraine to date, following the humiliating withdrawal of Russian troops from the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson. By Sunday, the drumbeat of denunciations broke the taboo against singling out President Vladimir V. Putin himself and Russias very system of government.

title: An Ode to Stacey Abrams
description: As the Bible tells the story, Moses delivers his people from bondage and to the promised land, but even with all his efforts he is not allowed to enter. He must gaze upon it from a distance.

title: Deadly Bombing in Istanbul Is Being Investigated as a Terrorist Attack
description: ISTANBUL  A bomb attack struck a bustling pedestrian thoroughfare in central Istanbul on Sunday, killing at least six people, in what officials said could be a terrorist attack, and shattering a sense of calm as Turkeys tourist industry works to recover from the pandemic.

title: Black Panther: Wakanda Forever Ends Box Office Drought
description: Black Panther: Wakanda Forever took in a superb $180 million at North American cinemas over the weekend, ending one of the worst box office droughts on record and reaffirming Disney-owned Marvel Studios as Hollywoods reigning blockbuster factory.

title: Republicans Seek Distance From Trump, and Other News From the Sunday Shows
description: Is former President Donald J. Trump the leader of the Republican Party?

title: Democrats Senate Victory Hands Biden a Critical Guardrail Against the G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  A day after clinching a narrow hold on the Senate, Democrats began laying plans on Sunday to use their majority as a bulwark for President Biden in Congress should Republicans wrest control of the House, including by confirming his nominees, killing G.O.P. legislation on arrival and promoting their own policies to voters.

title: T.S.A. Says Screening Missteps Allowed Box Cutters on Flight
description: Mistakes in screening procedures by Transportation Security Administration employees allowed a passenger to bring two box cutters aboard a Frontier Airlines flight from Cincinnati to Tampa, Fla., the agency said on Sunday.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Bidens Asian Diplomacy
description: World leaders are gathering in Indonesia for the G20 summit, which begins tomorrow.

title: With Outcome Still in Doubt, Congress Opens an Uncertain Post-Election Session
description: WASHINGTON  Midterm election results that defied expectations, leaving Democrats in control of the Senate and the House still up for grabs, have scrambled the agenda in Congress for the remainder of the year, leaving lawmakers toiling to determine how much can be accomplished in a brief year-end session that opens on Monday.

title: What We Learned From Week 10 in the N.F.L.
description: The Vikings and the Bills played to what might have been the N.F.L.s best finish so far this season, with Minnesota claiming yet another late comeback victory thanks in part to an unreal catch by Justin Jefferson to keep a fourth-quarter drive alive.

title: Lori Chavez-DeRemer, a Republican, flips an Oregon House seat.
description: Lori Chavez-DeRemer, a Republican, won a U.S. House seat in central Oregon on Sunday, according to The Associated Press, defeating her Democratic opponent, Jamie McLeod-Skinner, and handing her party a crucial victory in its push to win a  majority in the House.

title: Russia Tried to Absorb a Ukrainian City. It Didnt Work.
description: KHERSON, Ukraine  Iryna Dyagilevas daughter attended a school where the curriculum included memorizing the Russian national anthem. But teachers ignored it, instead quietly greeting students in the morning with a salute: Glory to Ukraine!

title: Youd Better Believe It!
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Todays puzzle is by Taylor Johnson, who is making his debut as a constructor for the New York Times Crossword. But Mr. Johnson is no stranger to crossword constructing. In fact, many of the constructors who appear in The Times have constructed puzzles in other places for some time before they show up in the Gray Lady.

title: An Emboldened Biden Now Faces a Tough Choice About His Own Future
description: WASHINGTON  These are heady days for President Biden. The midterm elections offered long-sought validation. Democrats held onto the Senate, and even if they lose the House it will be by a narrow margin. The Republicans are in retreat and, by the way, so are the Russians and, just a bit at least, so is inflation.

title: In an Unreal Ending, Vikings Come Back Against the Bills
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y.  The odds were stacked against the Minnesota Vikings. Down by 4 points to the Buffalo Bills, with two minutes remaining in regulation and pinned deep in their own end of the field, they had no choice but to run a play on fourth-and-18.

title: FTXs Collapse Casts a Pall on a Philanthropy Movement
description: In short order, the extraordinary collapse of the cryptocurrency exchange FTX has vaporized billions of dollars of customer deposits, prompted investigations by law enforcement and destroyed the fortune and reputation of the companys founder and chief executive, Sam Bankman-Fried.

title: Trump Wanted I.R.S. Investigations of Foes, Top Aide Says
description: While in office, President Donald J. Trump repeatedly told John F. Kelly, his second White House chief of staff, that he wanted a number of his perceived political enemies to be investigated by the Internal Revenue Service, Mr. Kelly said.

title: Ina Gartens Store-Bought Thanksgiving
description: Twenty years ago, Barefoot Contessa introduced TV viewers to Ina Garten, framed by stacks of white plates on white open shelves in her kitchen in East Hampton, N.Y. As its title suggested, the show conveyed a down-to-earth ease that felt attainable (even if the Viking stove she sauted on was not necessarily). Fans could dream about living in that shingle-style home, and then, if they followed her recipes, they could cook just like her.

title: The Old Man & the Pool Review: Wading Into Mike Birbiglias Comfort Zone
description: Mike Birbiglia knows what hes doing: At this point, his act is baked to golden perfection. Exploring new territories or branching out into unexpected formal terrain is not in the cards for this comedian. His new solo show, Mike Birbiglia: The Old Man & the Pool, directed by his regular collaborator Seth Barrish, is built along the same lines as his previous outings.

title: Mehran Karimi Nasseri, Who Inspired The Terminal, Dies in Paris Airport
description: Mehran Karimi Nasseri, an Iranian refugee who lived for 18 years in Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris and whose intriguing tale inspired the 2004 Steven Spielberg film The Terminal, died on Saturday in that same airport.

title: Behind Our Reporting on Puberty Blockers
description: We scoured the scientific evidence, interviewed doctors around the world and spoke to patients and families. Here's a closer look at what we found.

title: Replacing Legends on the College Basketball Court
description: Caleb Daniels was out to dinner with his family on a Wednesday night last spring when he received a text message from Joey Flannery, the director of basketball operations for the Villanova mens program.

title: The Secret Is Out on How Good the Grizzlies Can Be
description: SACRAMENTO  Ja Morant rejected the premise of the question.

title: Why a Barbers Chair Will Sit in the Museum of Broadway
description: Good morning. Its Monday. Well look at an understudy thats getting a moment in the spotlight  a barbers chair that was ready if a famous caricaturist needed it. Well also look at how foreign governments are using private investigators in this country for what one terrorism expert called low-cost, low-risk state-sponsored terrorism.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: At least six people died in a bomb attack on a bustling pedestrian thoroughfare in central Istanbul yesterday. By Sunday evening, Turkish officials had put the number of people wounded at 81, with two in critical condition.

title: Whats on TV This Week: The Walking Dead and the Latin Grammy Awards
description: Between network, cable and streaming, the modern television landscape is a vast one. Here are some of the shows, specials and movies coming to TV this week, Nov. 14-20. Details and times are subject to change.

title: Surrounded by Threats, Japan Rethinks Decades of Military Dependency
description: Over nearly seven decades, Japan has relied on commitments from the United States, its most important ally, for protection in the event of an enemy attack. Japan hosts the largest contingent of overseas American troops and regularly conducts drills with them. It has purchased more American-made F-35 stealth fighter jets than any other country outside the United States.

title: Word of the Day: intimation
description: The word intimation has appeared in eight articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Oct. 2 in the book review When It Comes to Mothers, Fact and Fiction Blur by Janice Y.K. Lee:

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: MONDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: Extreme Candidates and Positions Came Back to Bite in Midterms
description: A surprisingly nuanced verdict in the midterm elections has delivered at least one important conclusion about the state of the national mood: In battleground states and swing districts across the country, voters voiced their support for moderation.

title: TikTok Builds Itself Into an Ads Juggernaut
description: Last month, Tiffany & Company shared a sleek black-and-white video featuring the pop superstar Beyonc dripping in gems and surrounded by nightclub revelers. The minute-long jewelry ad was posted on Instagram, where it drew 1.6 million views.

title: They Paused Puberty, but Is There a Cost?
description: The medical guidance was direct.

title: Quotation of the Day: TikTok Ads Rake It In From Rivals
description: TikTok is eating the world. The only thing that matters in the world of entertainment is time spent. If you have less time spent because TikTok is taking share, thats negative for your advertising business.

title: Yellen Encourages Vaccinations in China as Covid Restrictions Slow Growth
description: BALI, Indonesia  Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen said on Monday that she hopes China is able to roll out a more effective vaccination campaign to combat the coronavirus. Thus far, Beijing has largely contained its spread with strict lockdowns and travel restrictions that have slowed its economy and weighed on global economic growth.

title: Iran Attacks Opposition Bases in Iraqs Kurdistan Region
description: SULAIMANIYA, Iraq  Iran launched ballistic missile and drone attacks across the border at Kurdish Iranian opposition bases in Iraq on Monday, killing at least two people and wounding eight others after what an Iranian official said were repeated warnings to Iraq to expel the groups.

title: Hong Kong Demands Inquiry After Protest Song Is Played Before Rugby Match
description: The Hong Kong government on Monday demanded a full and in-depth investigation after a song associated with the pro-democracy protests of 2019 was played instead of the Chinese national anthem before a match by the citys rugby sevens team at a tournament in Incheon, South Korea.

title: The Benevolents
description: Volunteers at a Montreal call center train to be an ear for a lonely society.

title: Brian Eno Reveals the Hidden Purpose of All Art
description: Im absolutely fascinated by this question, because I think I have an answer, and I dont think it has ever been well answered.

title: Even Melania Must Know Trump Blew It
description: Marriage is hard. Even the happiest couples will occasionally bicker, nitpick or wear on each others nerves. So consider just how bumpy things could get if someones thin-skinned, emotionally erratic, accountability-averse husband started criticizing her for his high-profile screw-ups.

title: New York Democrats urge Hochul to push out the state party chair.
description: Less than a week after New York Democrats suffered the loss of four congressional seats that could cost them control of the House, a call for new leadership in the state party is growing.

title: How Have You Gotten Over Disappointment?
description: Think about a time when you had to do something difficult, stressful or time-consuming, like audition for a play, try out for a team or take an important test. Now, suppose you were told you had to do it all over again because of an accident or a mistake that had nothing to do with you.

title: Dont Be Fooled, Trumps Hold on the G.O.P. Is Stronger Than Ever
description: Did Donald Trump lose in the midterms? Plenty of people declared that he did, from liberal pundits to the Murdoch newspapers  the latter delivering a double whammy from the front page of The New York Post (TRUMPTY DUMPTY) and the editorial page of The Wall Street Journal (Trump Is the Republican Partys Biggest Loser).

title: If You Want to Understand How Dangerous Elon Musk Is, Look Outside America
description: With the benefit of ample hindsight, it has come to feel inevitable that Twitter would turn into a cesspool of abuse and misinformation and that the powerful  governments, politicians, corporations, celebrities  would find ways to control and manipulate it to their own benefit.

title: NASA Is Returning to the Moon This Week. Why Do We Feel Conflicted?
description: NASA plans this week to return to the moon for the first time since Apollo 17 in 1972. The effort is part of a series of spaceflights under the agencys Artemis program. After multiple delays, the first Artemis launch  a test flight without crew members  is slated for early Wednesday. (No doubt NASAs fingers are crossed.)

title: New York City, Once a Minimum Wage Leader, Now Lags Behind
description: When New York Citys minimum wage first reached $15 nearly four years ago, New York was at the forefront of the movement to raise living standards for workers in the fast-food industry and other low-paying sectors. But in recent months, as the costs of rent, groceries and utilities have surged, the minimum wage in a growing list of cities, including Washington, Los Angeles and Denver, has vaulted past.

title: Do I Really Have to Obey Party Dress Codes?
description: The party may actually be the last stronghold of the dress code, a sartorial diktat that is increasingly falling out of favor everywhere, from the workplace, to the school to Congress. As the balance of power shifts away from the institution and toward the individual, the idea of any establishment decreeing what is and is not appropriate dress, when dress is so deeply intertwined with personal identity, seems increasingly old-fashioned.

title: In a Lonely World, Theyre Here to Listen
description: I remember feeling very alone when I moved to Montreal in 2013. Moving about the city, I also felt the loneliness in the strangers around me. The harm isolation does to our mental well-being is well documented, but in a world full of people, finding someone to emotionally connect with seems like an impossible task.

title: University Presses Are Keeping American Literature Alive
description: Last fall, I went around the house pulling out beloved books published by university presses because I was planning to write an essay about University Press Week, which falls during November every year. My stack of books grew high and calved into two stacks, and then again into three, all heaped in front of the bookcase next to my worktable. I had to nudge them aside every time I reached for another book. It got to where I hardly noticed them, even though they were in plain view all day long.

title: There Are Republicans Who Feel Low After Election Day. And Then Theres Ron DeSantis.
description: Bret Stephens: Gail, remember the old Rolaids ad that asked, How do you spell relief? I think the answer is m-i-d-t-e-r-m-s.

title: Turkey in a T-Shirt, and Other Thanksgiving Gimmicks Weve Tried
description: Americas relentless drive to innovate has led to the Constitution and the iPhone. But has it produced a better Thanksgiving turkey?

title: What One Importers Legal Fight Says About the Power of Cargo Giants
description: Like the rest of the e-commerce world, Jacob Weiss was contending with excruciating difficulties in getting his goods  mostly furniture  across the Pacific from factories in China.

title: What You Get for $3 Million in California
description: A 1940 cottage in Newport Beach, a four-bedroom house in Larkspur and a French country-style estate in Sacramento.

title: Time Has Run Out for the Leap Second
description: Roughly every four years, an extra day gets tacked onto the end of February, a time-keeping convention known as the leap year. The practice of adjusting the calendar with an extra day was established by Julius Caesar more than 2,000 years ago and modified in the 16th century by Pope Gregory XIII, bequeathing us the Julian and Gregorian calendars.

title: A Pizza Pilgrimage to Campania
description: It began with truffles. White ones, from Alba, shaved over a butter-daubed wedge of dough, then ditto with a heady black variety from Irpinia. Seated in the courtyard of the famed Naples pizzeria Concettina ai Tre Santi, I watched my waiter with wide eyes as my evening pizza marathon commenced with an intoxicating bang.

title: $3 Million Homes in California
description: Balboa Island is a community with a small-town feel within the city of Newport Beach. This recently renovated house, which has been in the same family for decades, is a few blocks from Marine Avenue, a thoroughfare with numerous businesses, including an Italian restaurant, beachwear shops and a retro-style candy store. It is less than 10 minutes from the Fashion Island shopping mall and Corona del Mar, a popular shopping and nightlife hub.

title: Kari Lakes path to victory narrows in the Arizona governors race.
description: Latest news: Katie Hobbs wins governors race against Kari Lake

title: The Nations Report Card on Remote Learning
description: On the first nationwide test of American students since the pandemic, scores plummeted to levels not seen in 20 years. The results show how challenging it was to keep students on track during the pandemic.

title: Heres a Look at the Midterm Races That Remain Undetermined
description: While control of the Senate has been settled, the House is still up for grabs.

title: Ukraines Advances
description: Russias retreat last week from Kherson, a southern port city that it had seized shortly after invading Ukraine, was one of the biggest setbacks yet to President Vladimir Putins war effort. A renewed Ukrainian military offensive has clearly put Russian troops on the run.

title: Russias Foreign Ministry denies a report that Lavrov was hospitalized in Bali.
description: Russias foreign minister, Sergei V. Lavrov, on Monday denied that he had been hospitalized following reports that he had experienced a health problem ahead of the high-profile Group of 20 summit of global leaders in Indonesia.

title: Libert, galit, Millinery?
description: The Olympics mascot is typically a creature of some kind. But for the Paris 2024 Summer Games, it will be a hat.

title: Remaking Rosters for a Changing Game
description: LAS VEGAS  Beginning next season, the way the game is played and looks in Major League Baseball will be noticeably different. In the hopes of injecting more action, shaving time off games and reducing injuries, M.L.B. will, for the time ever, introduce a pitch clock, ban defensive infield shifts and enlarge the bases.

title: Xaviera Simmons Is Embarrassed for America
description: Xaviera Simmons is ready to move on. When we met at the Queens Museum two weeks before the opening of her new show, Crisis Makes a Book Club, the New York-based interdisciplinary artist, who is known for her landscape photography and staged self-portraits, ruminated on the vexing cycle of social eruption and passivity that defines American attitudes toward white supremacist violence. Surrounded by the buzz of assistants installing her exhibition, Simmons recalled how the social upheaval of 2020 fell into a familiar pattern: The antiracism uprisings and the suffering laid bare by the pandemic led to frenzied institutional acknowledgments of racial inequity followed by total stasis. She compared the feelings these events and their aftermath inspired in her to the overwhelming agony of heartbreak, and she has experienced enough of that to understand that one cant write new chapters without breaking away from old patterns.

title: Moderna Says New Covid Booster Strengthens Immune Response Against Subvariants
description: WASHINGTON  A new study by Moderna suggests that its updated coronavirus booster strengthens a key component of the immune systems defense against the Omicron subvariant that accounted for most infections in the United States in recent months.

title: Biden and Xi Meet Amid Heightened U.S.-China Relations
description: This was the first face-to-face meeting between President Biden and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, as top leaders.

title: Who Bears Blame for FTXs Failure?
description: Andrew here. Over dinners and text messages this weekend, financiers on Wall Street and Silicon Valley, and policymakers in Washington, debated whether the multibillion-dollar collapse of FTX, the crypto exchange founded by the wunderkind Sam Bankman-Fried, should be compared to the fall of Enron, Lehman Brothers, Bernie Madoff or MF Global.

title: Watch Live: Biden Speaks After Meeting With Xi
description: President Biden and President Xi Jinping of China met before the Group of 20 summit in Indonesia. It was their first face-to-face meeting as top leaders.

title: People are stuck in the libraries: Students describe a campus that is sheltering in place.
description: Eva Surovell, a senior and the editor in chief of The Cavalier Daily, the University of Virginias student newspaper, said by phone early Monday that students were sheltering in place across the campus: People are stuck in the libraries, theyre stuck in academic buildings, theyre stuck in you name it, she said.

title: U.K. and France Sign New Deal to Stem Small-Boat Migrant Crossings
description: LONDON  Britain and France signed a new agreement on Monday to stem the growing number of small boats carrying migrants over the busy waterway between them, a sign of thawing relations on an issue that has become a sore point for the embattled British government.

title: Turkey Accuses U.S. of Complicity in Istanbul Attack That Killed 6
description: ISTANBUL  The Turkish authorities arrested a woman on Monday they suspect was behind the deadly bombing in central Istanbul a day earlier, saying she had been sent to Turkey from Syria by Kurdish militants to carry out the attack.

title: Qatar World Cup Faces New Edict: Hide the Beer
description: Follow live coverage of Argentina vs. Mexico and the latest World Cup standings.

title: Jeff Bezos Says He Will Give Away Most of His Fortune
description: Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, said he would give away most of his money to charity, making him the latest billionaire to pledge to donate his vast fortune during his lifetime.

title: The C.I.A. director meets with his Russian counterpart to warn against the use of nuclear weapons in Ukraine.
description: William J. Burns, the director of the Central Intelligence Agency, met with his Russian counterpart in Turkey on Monday to warn Russia against the use of nuclear weapons in Ukraine, a White House spokesman said.

title: Family of Prominent Egyptian Political Prisoner Says It Has Proof He Is Alive
description: CAIRO  After more than a week of silence, uncertainty and escalating controversy, the family of Egypts best-known political prisoner said it had received word from him on Monday that he was alive after about seven months on hunger strike and several days of refusing water.

title: Wordle Wrap-Up: Nov. 7 to 13
description: Hi Wordlers! Welcome to Wordle Wrap-Up, a reminder of which words were answers this week. For stories, stats and brain teasers, sign up for the Gameplay newsletter. For a daily reminder to play Wordle, sign up for reminders.

title: La Brea Tar Pits Begin an Unusual Rebrand
description: The La Brea Tar Pits are among Los Angeless best-known attractions  and among the least understood. The sprawling, grassy grounds on the Miracle Mile are probably better known for the fake mammoth family than for the institutions scientific contributions. Thats why the museums curators are hoping a long-awaited revamp could breathe life into the landmark.

title: U.S. and China Restart Climate Talks
description: BALI, Indonesia  President Biden and President Xi Jinping of China agreed on Monday to restart talks between their countries as part of international climate negotiations, a breakthrough in the effort to avert catastrophic global warming.

title: At the summit, Bidens advisers provide clues about U.S. strategy on China.
description: At any bilateral summit, attention is focused on the two leaders facing off across the negotiating table. But the advisers sitting next to President Biden as he met with Xi Jinping, the Chinese leader, on Monday sent a clear signal about who he listens to.

title: Art Tells New Jersey Stories at Newarks New Terminal A
description: Move over, La Guardia. Newark Liberty International Airports just-completed Terminal A makeover comes with two monumental new works of art.

title: Lithium-Ion Batteries in E-Bikes and Other Devices Pose Fire Risks
description: A lithium-ion battery in an apartment with at least five e-bikes caused a fire in Manhattan this month that injured almost 40 people. The fire, which was one of 188 caused by lithium-ion batteries in New York City this year, led to warnings about risks associated with the batteries and ways to minimize them.

title: Republicans Appear on Track to Take the House
description: After a long week counting mail votes out west, a Republican House majority now seems in sight.

title: Biden Says Meeting With Xi Was Open and Candid
description: President Biden and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, met face to face for a nearly three-hour meeting amid rising tensions between the U.S. and China.

title: Shucked Is Corny. Its Country. And Its Coming to Broadway.
description: Shucked, a corn-pone musical with roots in country music and rural humor, will arrive on Broadway early next year after more than a decade of starts and stops.

title: Marine Drill Instructor Charged in Recruits Death
description: The U.S. Marine Corps has charged a former drill instructor with negligent homicide and other offenses in the death of a recruit during a grueling training exercise last year, a Marines spokesman said.

title: Amazon Is Said to Plan to Lay Off Thousands of Employees
description: Amazon plans to lay off approximately 10,000 people in corporate and technology jobs starting as soon as this week, people with knowledge of the matter said, in what would be the largest job cuts in the companys history.

title: Republicans appear on track to take a majority in the House.
description: After a long week counting mail votes out west, a Republican House majority now seems in sight.

title: How to Make Thanksgiving Vegetarian
description: As Thanksgiving Day draws ever closer, cooks all over the United States are dusting off old recipe cards for family favorites, like Grandma Judys pumpkin bread and Aunt Rhodas deviled eggs. Cooking heirloom dishes brings the past, and lost loved ones, right back to the table. My dad may not be with us, feeding me scraps of skin as he carves the turkey, but his anadama bread is a molasses-tinged memento that is as tasty as it is sentimental.

title: Winning Signs From the New York City Marathon
While Other Insects Played, This Species Evolved the Blade
description: They are fruit flies, but they eat leaves. And to feed themselves, the females scrape and scoop vegetation with  this is what researchers actually sometimes call them  vaginal teeth. Then they turn their mouths to the plant juices theyve liberated, and lap them up.

title: Dogfooding
description: Software engineers are hungry for excellence. Dogs are hungry for dog food. And software engineers at many companies are hungry to dogfood.

title: University of California Academic Employees Strike for Higher Pay
description: SACRAMENTO  Tens of thousands of academic workers across the University of California system walked out on Monday in one of the nations largest strikes in recent years, as teaching assistants, researchers and other university employees called for significant pay increases in the face of rising housing costs.

title: Google Agrees to $392 Million Privacy Settlement With 40 States
description: WASHINGTON  Google agreed to a record $391.5 million privacy settlement with a 40-state coalition of attorneys general on Monday for charges that it misled users into thinking they had turned off location tracking in their account settings even as the company continued collecting that information.

title: Dan McCafferty, Nazareth Frontman Who Sang Love Hurts, Dies at 76
description: Dan McCafferty, who as the frontman of the Scottish rock band Nazareth scored an international hit in the mid-1970s with the ballad Love Hurts, died on Tuesday. He was 76.

title: A Hard Cider That Takes Its Cues From Sake
description: Wlffer Estate Vineyard has a deep portfolio of ciders, but its latest one, Oishii Cider, stands apart. Its crystal clear, and the first whiff and taste reveal a subtle slice of apple. Made in collaboration with the local sake maker Brooklyn Kura, Oishii Cider is slowly cold-fermented with sake yeast, giving it a sake-style profile at 13 percent alcohol without surrendering the apples. (Oishii means delicious in Japanese, but the apple variety Delicious is not used for the cider.) Chilled, its a fine aperitif with a whisper of sweetness and pairs beautifully with Brie-style cheeses.

title: As the Pandemic Drags On, Americans Struggle for New Balance
description: Jordi Salomon put the pandemic in the rearview mirror long ago. Her two little boys are back at school, where there has been no mask requirement since the spring. They attend birthday parties and theme parks, visit the library and play with friends.

title: Documents Detail Foreign Government Spending at Trump Hotel
description: WASHINGTON  Officials from six nations spent more than $750,000 at former President Donald J. Trumps hotel in Washington when they were seeking to influence his administration, renting rooms for more than $10,000 per night, according to documents that his former accounting firm turned over to Congress.

title: Lawyers for Rikers Detainees Will Ask Judge to Impose Federal Control
description: Lawyers for people detained on Rikers Island intend to ask a federal judge to take control of the jail complex away from New York City, according to a letter filed with the court on Monday, setting the stage for a potentially pivotal hearing this week.

title: Who Will Win the Race to Generate Electricity From Ocean Tides?
description: ABOARD THE PLAT-I 6.40 GENERATING PLATFORM, Nova Scotia  The Bay of Fundy, off the Canadian provinces of Nova Scotia and New Brunswick, has long tantalized and frustrated engineers hoping to harness its record-setting 50-foot high tide to generate electricity.

title: Justice Department and Trump Lawyers Clash Over Status of Seized Documents
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department has urged a special master to broadly reject assertions by former President Donald J. Trump that he owns a range of documents the F.B.I. seized from his Florida residence and that he can invoke executive privilege to bar criminal investigators from looking at some of them.

title: Supreme Court Allows Subpoena for Arizona Republicans Phone Records
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court paved the way on Monday for the House committee investigating the Capitol attack to obtain phone records of Kelli Ward, the chairwoman of the Arizona Republican Party.

title: We Want to Hear About Your Most Important Friendships
description: Were living through a somewhat perilous moment for friendship in America. Social circles were shrinking even before the Covid pandemic hit  a trend that only accelerated as it dragged on. In 2021, 13 percent of women and 8 percent of men ages 30 to 49 said theyd lost touch with most of their friends. And friendship experts argue that we have a collective tendency to view platonic love as somehow less important or valuable than romantic love.

title: Loyal to God and Trump, Mike Pence Defends His Record
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Pence Says Trump Was Reckless in Assailing Him on Jan. 6
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence told ABC News that he was angered by former President Donald J. Trumps reckless tweet assailing him during the Capitol riot on Jan. 6, 2021, in his first interview about the violent efforts by Mr. Trumps supporters to keep him in power.

title: Drake and 21 Savage Bump Taylor Swift From the Top
description: When Drake released his last album, Honestly, Nevermind, in June, it opened at No. 1 but had disappointing numbers for one of streamings megastars. One bright spot: Its standout track, Jimmy Cooks, featuring the Atlanta-based rapper 21 Savage, went to No. 1 on Billboards Hot 100 singles chart.

title: Stymied by Protests, Iran Unleashes Its Wrath on Its Youth
description: One girl, a 14-year-old, was incarcerated in an adult prison alongside drug offenders. A 16-year-old boy had his nose broken in detention after a beating by security officers. A 13-year-old girl was physically attacked by plainclothes militia who raided her school.

title: Brazil, Indonesia and Congo Sign Rainforest Protection Pact
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  The three countries that are home to more than half of the worlds tropical rainforests  Brazil, Indonesia and the Democratic Republic of Congo  are pledging to work together to establish a funding mechanism that could help preserve the forests, which  help regulate the Earths climate and sustain a variety of animals, plants, birds and insects.

title: Philadelphias Joel Embiid Makes N.B.A. History
description: As the Philadelphia 76ers stuttered to a hit-and-miss start, there was a sense that their star center, Joel Embiid, needed to break through.

title: After Nevada: The New Political Landscape
description: To the Editor:

title: Blinken to Visit China in Early 2023 After Biden and Xis Meeting
description: WASHINGTON  Antony J. Blinken, the U.S. secretary of state, plans to visit China early next year to follow up on the meeting between President Biden and Chinas leader, Xi Jinping, in Bali, Indonesia, a State Department official in Washington said on Monday.

title: What We Know About Naomi Bidens White House Wedding
description: This article has been updated to reflect news developments.

title: Dick Gregory, a Humorist With Many Passions and a Singular Gift
description: By the time I was old enough to know who Dick Gregory was, in the early 1980s, he was on the downslope of his career. Hed left stand-up comedy, where hed been a pioneer. His work during the civil rights era  he marched in Selma, and had been close to Medgar Evers and Martin Luther King Jr.  was behind him too.

title: Historic Deauville Hotel Demolished in Miami Beach
description: The 17-story hotel, built in 1957, was imploded after the property fell into disrepair over the years. The Miami Beach hotel once hosted the Beatles and President John F. Kennedy.

title: German Government Nationalizes Gas Unit Seized From Gazprom
description: The German government said on Monday that it would nationalize a former subsidiary of Gazprom, Russias state-owned natural gas monopoly, to maintain the countrys energy security.

title: F.B.I. Had Informants in Proud Boys, Court Papers Suggest
description: The F.B.I. had as many as eight informants inside the far-right Proud Boys in the months surrounding the storming of the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, recent court papers indicate, raising questions about how much federal investigators were able to learn from them about the violent mob attack both before and after it took place.

title: Students and Teachers: How Is the School Year Going for You?
description: This school year, students and teachers returned to campus in a more normal setting. While Covid remains a concern, it may no longer be the main issue that educators and parents are worried about.

title: Rauw Alejandros Cosmic Reggaeton Takes Flight
description: Growing up in Puerto Rico, Rauw Alejandro often hid the mix CDs his uncle gave him, which usually included explicit lyrics, from his father. They featured puckish pop-punk bands like Blink-182, but also the precocious stars of underground, a synthesis of hip-hop and dancehall that predated reggaeton.

title: Elon Musk Faces His Waterloo
description: Autocratic chief executives are dazzling. Unconstrained by the bonds that hold back ordinary executives, they soar to higher highs and crash to lower lows. Todays case study in dazzlement: Elon Musk, the worlds wealthiest person, who soared with Tesla and is crashing with Twitter.

title: The Big Lie Is Going Global. We Saw It in Brazil.
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  What happens in Washington doesnt always stay in Washington. Donald Trumps playbook of poisoning the polity with misinformation for years and seeking to discredit electoral results and peaceful transitions of power is being exported and deployed beyond the United States and becoming a transnational threat to democracy.

title: Three Virginia football players were killed in the shooting.
description: The suspect and at least three of the victims in the shooting at the University of Virginia on Sunday night had links to the universitys football team.

title: Twitter Users, Sensing the End of an Era, Confess Their Secrets
description: In the chaos that followed Elon Musks takeover of Twitter, one user, thinking the platform might not be around much longer, revealed a secret from her college days. Another made a last-minute plea to crowdfund her medical bills. Another admitted she bit into whole Kit Kat bars without breaking them apart first.

title: Republicans Pushing to Move Past Trump Face One Big Obstacle: His Voters
description: Trump rallies arent where you expect to hear hard-nosed analysis of Donald J. Trumps chances of winning back the White House. But Chuck Smith, an ardent supporter who recently drove two hours to stand under the scorching Arizona sun to cheer Mr. Trump, was blunt.

title: With Tensions Mounting, Biden and Xi Try a Warmer Tone
description: BALI, Indonesia  After months of deepening contention between the United States and China, President Biden and President Xi Jinping met in person for the first time as national leaders on Monday with a tone of mutual engagement that acknowledged that both their countries faced challenges from global conflict and economic headwinds.

title: How Cortez Masto Beat the Odds and Sealed the Senate Majority
description: WASHINGTON  For months, it appeared that historical precedent and stiff political headwinds could doom Senator Catherine Cortez Mastos re-election bid in Nevada, with voters in her state facing some of the highest gas prices in the country and a national landscape seemingly stacked against the Democratic Party.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Biden and Xi Discuss Taiwan
description: President Biden and Xi Jinping, Chinas leader, met for nearly three hours yesterday.

title: Appeals Court Blocks Bidens Student Debt Cancellation Plan
description: A federal appeals court on Monday issued an injunction halting President Bidens student debt cancellation plan, further clouding the future of the presidents promise to eliminate hundreds of billions of dollars in debt for tens of millions of people.

title: McCarthy Scrounges for Support to Become Speaker as Republicans Feud
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Kevin McCarthy of California, the minority leader, scrounged on Monday for the support he would need to become speaker if Republicans gain control of the House, facing resistance from a newly emboldened right flank as his party grappled with its historically weak performance in the midterm elections.

title: Giuliani Will Not Face Federal Charges Over Lobbying, Prosecutors Say
description: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan said on Monday that they would not bring charges against Rudolph W. Giuliani in a long-running investigation into whether he violated lobbying laws.

title: 4 University of Idaho Students Killed in Crime of Passion
description: [Follow the latest news in the deaths of four University of Idaho students.]

title: How Sam Bankman-Frieds Crypto Empire Collapsed
description: In less than a week, the cryptocurrency billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried went from industry leader to industry villain, lost most of his fortune, saw his $32 billion company plunge into bankruptcy and became the target of investigations by the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Justice Department.

title: When Does Science Go Too Far?
description: It was late in 1972  a year in which the science of genetic engineering really began to sizzle  that two California researchers announced the unusually tidy transfer of genetic information from one bacterium to another with help from a specialized enzyme. It was a scientifically heralded result, but behind the hoopla was just one small catch. The information transferred enabled a common human disease bacterium, E. coli, to resist not just one antibiotic, but two.

title: Jay Leno Sustains Serious Burns in Gasoline Fire
description: The comedian and television host Jay Leno, known for his expansive collection of cars, sustained burns in a gasoline fire but was expecting to recover, he said on Monday.

title: Georgias Senate Runoff Is Complicated by 2021 Voting Law
description: ATLANTA  A state holiday that once honored the Confederate general Robert E. Lee could take away a day of early voting in some Georgia counties in the Senate runoff between Senator Raphael Warnock and Herschel Walker.

title: U.S.-Russia Talks
description: Welcome to the Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, your guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: C.I.A. Director Warns Russian Counterpart Against Using Nuclear Weapons
description: WASHINGTON  The head of the Central Intelligence Agency warned his Russian counterpart against using nuclear weapons in a face-to-face meeting on Monday in Turkey, White House officials announced, part of the Biden administrations effort to reduce the threat of escalation in the war in Ukraine.

title: U.S. Investigating Killing of Al Jazeera Journalist in West Bank, Israel Says
description: JERUSALEM  The U.S. Department of Justice has opened an investigation into the killing of Shireen Abu Akleh, a Palestinian American journalist, in the occupied West Bank, the Israeli Defense Ministry announced on Monday night.

title: Boston Globe Names NPRs Nancy Barnes Its Next Editor
description: Nancy Barnes, a top news executive at NPR, will lead The Boston Globe, the newspaper announced on Monday.

title: U.S. Fines Airlines More Than $7 Million for Not Providing Refunds
description: The Transportation Department said on Monday that it had fined a half-dozen airlines a total of more than $7 million for failing to provide timely refunds to customers. The departments intervention contributed to the airlines issuing more than $600 million in refunds, it said.

title: An American Paralympian Says He Was Sexually Abused by a Teammate
description: An American Paralympic swimmer accused a teammate of sexually abusing him while training and competing for the national team, according to a lawsuit filed in federal court in Colorado, bringing new scrutiny to both the U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee and the U.S. Center for SafeSport, a nonprofit organization created to address allegations of sexual abuse of athletes in Olympic sports.

title: Claims of Voter Fraud Build, but Not to Same Degree as in 2020
description: It took a few days for people who have spent the past two years questioning the integrity of elections to find their voice.

title: How Democrats Quietly Meddled in G.O.P. Senate Recruitment
description: They called it the Summer of Chaos.

title: Trump Is Weak, but the G.O.P. Is Weaker
description: After their partys disappointing performance in the midterms, Republican elites seem to have decided that Donald Trump is their big problem. The Murdoch media empire has been trashing the former president. Many donors and operatives are reportedly rallying around Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida. But Trump, who is widely expected to announce his 2024 presidential campaign on Tuesday, wont go quietly.

title: Some of the House Races That Remain Undecided and by How Much
description: Control of the House of Representatives will be decided in the coming days or maybe weeks  sorry  by the outcomes of around 15 races. More than half of them are in California, and the rest are in a smattering of other states.

title: Accounts of Torture Emerge From Kherson, Ukraines City of Fear
description: KHERSON, Ukraine  Olena Naumovas descent into two weeks of terror began in late August, when three Russian soldiers with automatic rifles banged on her door in the occupied city of Kherson. She said they ordered her to turn over her gun. She had no gun.

title: Miami Beach Hotel That Hosted the Beatles Is Demolished
description: In its heyday, the Deauville Beach Resort, a Miami Beach hotel, was a sleek emblem of South Florida cool, hosting the Beatles, Frank Sinatra and John F. Kennedy, not to mention innumerable weddings, proms and poolside parties.

title: Jan. 6 Committee Weighs Further Actions as Trump Refuses to Testify
description: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol said on Monday that a contempt of Congress referral against former President Donald J. Trump could be an option after Mr. Trump failed to appear for a scheduled deposition.

title: Jennifer Siebel Newsom Testifies in Weinstein Sex Crimes Trial
description: LOS ANGELES  Jennifer Siebel Newsom, a documentary filmmaker and the wife of the California governor, Gavin Newsom, began testifying on Monday that Harvey Weinstein had sexually assaulted her when she was an actor starting out in the industry.

title: Gunman Charged With Killing Three Fellow Students at the University of Virginia
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  A 22-year-old student at the University of Virginia was charged with fatally shooting three members of the universitys football team and wounding two others as they returned from a class field trip on Sunday night, an attack that led to an overnight campuswide lockdown while the authorities searched for the gunman for roughly 12 hours.

title: Julio Rodrguez and Michael Harris II Are M.L.B.s Top Rookies
description: One made his teams opening day roster. The other was not in the major leagues until late May. But once October came around, Julio Rodrguez of the Seattle Mariners and Michael Harris II of the Atlanta Braves were not only the starting center fielders for their playoff teams, but both also had signed contract extensions that promised to keep them in place into the 2030s.

title: Four Stark Lessons From a Democratic Upset
description: When I reached Marie Gluesenkamp Perez on Monday morning, the Democratic representative-elect from Washington State was sitting on the steps of the U.S. Capitol.

title: Japans Economy Shrinks Unexpectedly, Hit by a Weak Yen and Rising Inflation
description: Japans economy, the worlds third largest, unexpectedly shrank in the three-month period from July to September, as a weak yen and high inflation eroded Japanese consumers buying power and sapped businesses strength.

title: Corrections: Nov. 15, 2022
description: An article on Monday about assertions by John F. Kelly, President Donald J. Trumps second White House chief of staff, that Mr. Trump repeatedly sought investigations of his perceived political enemies by the Internal Revenue Service, misspelled the surname of the former head of the Special Operations Command. He is William H. McRaven, not McCraven.

title: Katie Hobbs, Who Defied Trump in Arizona, Tops Kari Lake for Governor
description: PHOENIX  Katie Hobbs, who as Arizonas secretary of state stood up to efforts by allies of former President Donald J. Trump to overturn the 2020 election, has clinched a victory in the states race for governor, according to The Associated Press.

title: Trump Family Signs Deal With Saudi Real Estate Developer
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump family has struck a deal with a Saudi-based real estate company to license its name to a housing and golf complex that will be built in Oman, renewing a swirl of questions about former President Donald J. Trumps mixing of politics and business just as he appears poised to announce a third presidential candidacy.

title: Ex-Detective in Kansas Helped Men Run Sex Trafficking Operation, U.S. Says
description: A former police detective in Kansas who was charged in September with sexually assaulting two women while on duty more than two decades ago now faces new federal charges that he helped three other men run a violent sex trafficking operation that preyed on underage girls in the 1990s, the Justice Department said on Monday.

title: Turn to Others for Assistance
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Happy Tuesday, solvers! Today we have a puzzle from the constructor Sandy Ganzell that features a densely packed theme thats sure to please solvers of all (and I mean ALL) ages. Ill say more about that theme in a bit, but first, lets take a look at some of the tougher clues in todays puzzle.

title: Quotation of the Day: Residents of Kherson Describe Torture and Abuse
description: I lived under the Soviet Union, and I never want to go back to the Soviet Union.

title: Hun Sen of Cambodia Cuts G20 Trip Short After Testing Positive for Coronavirus
description: BALI, Indonesia  Prime Minister Hun Sen of Cambodia said on Tuesday that he had tested positive for the coronavirus and that his delegation would cut short its trip to Bali for the Group of 20 summit.

title: What Riding in a Self-Driving Tesla Tells Us About the Future of Autonomy
description: We took a ride with Teslas experimental self-driving system. It was by turns intriguing, impressive and scary.

title: Michelle Steel holds her G.O.P. House seat in California.
description: Representative Michelle Steel, Republican of California, has won election to a second term in Orange County, according to The Associated Press.

title: Leaders at the G20 summit urge an end to the Russia-Ukraine war.
description: BALI, Indonesia  The annual Group of 20 summit began on Tuesday under the shadow of the war in Ukraine and concerns about a possible global recession, as leaders of some of the worlds wealthiest nations and biggest emerging markets pushed for a coordinated response to the threats.

title: Roberta Flack Has A.L.S. and Can No Longer Sing, Her Publicist Says
description: Roberta Flack, the highly decorated vocalist whose smash hits like Killing Me Softly With His Song made her among the most recognizable voices of the 1970s, has been diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and can no longer sing, according to a statement released by her publicist on Monday.

title: For Western Weapons, the Ukraine War Is a Beta Test
description: Three months ago, as Ukrainian troops were struggling to advance against Russian forces in the south, the militarys headquarters in Kyiv quietly deployed a valuable new weapon to the battlefield.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Hundreds of minors in Iran have been beaten and detained for joining the protests calling for social freedom and political change that have convulsed the country for the past two months, and at least 50 have died in the crackdown, according to Iranian lawyers and rights activists. Iranian officials have said the average age of protesters is 15.

title: The City Charter Has a New Preamble to Promote Equity
description: Good morning. Today well look at ballot measures that passed last week that call for the city to reconstruct, revise and reimagine institutions and laws to promote justice and equity. Well also look at why some Democrats say the state party chairman should resign.

title: What is the G20?
description: Established in 1999 after a series of major international debt crises, the Group of 20 aims to unite world leaders around shared economic, political and health challenges. Here is a look at what the group is and does.

title: These 17 Swing Voters Have a Very Clear Message for Donald Trump
description: Seventeen swing voters discuss how they voted in this years midterm elections and Donald Trumps plans for 2024.

title: After the Biden-Xi meeting, Beijing signals optimism over relations with Washington.
description: The prominent position of the photo on the front page of Chinas main official newspaper spoke volumes: In it, the nations leader, Xi Jinping, smiled and shook hands with President Biden against a backdrop of Chinese and American flags.

title: Late Night Celebrates Tiffany Trumps Wedding
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Word of the Day: formidable
description: The word formidable has appeared in 503 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Nov. 8 in the album review Her Loss Is Playtime for Drake and 21 Savage by Jon Caramanica:

title: John Aniston, Veteran Television Actor, Dies at 89
description: John Aniston, a veteran television actor who was born in Greece and played a memorable Greek villain for more than three decades on Days of Our Lives, died on Friday. He was 89.

title: NASA Will Try to Launch Moon Rocket After 2 Scrubs and 2 Hurricanes
description: KENNEDY SPACE CENTER  Last Thursday, NASAs giant new multibillion-dollar rocket was standing on the launchpad in the middle of Hurricane Nicole.

title: Underwater Dining
description: Use your imagination to write the opening of a short story or poem inspired by this illustration  or tell us about a memory from your own life that this image makes you think of.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: TUESDAY  Hi busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below. For more Spelling Bee conversation, check out Deb Amlens weekly humor column, Diary of a Spelling Bee Fanatic.

title: When Breaking News Is a Tweet Away
description: In the days since Elon Musk took control of Twitter, roughly half of its employees have been laid off. The company also introduced a revamped subscription model, amid repeated changes in direction. But the social media platform has been a saga for years, even before Elon got involved, said Ryan Mac, a Times reporter who covers technology.

title: Bringing Sexy Back  To Fight H.I.V.
description: Efforts to make sex safer almost always focus on the bad stuff: what to do to avoid a terrible infection or potentially deadly virus. They rarely acknowledge the good stuff: usually the reason people have sex in the first place.

title: Frustrations Grow Over Companys Response to CPAP Recalls
description: By 2015, Philips Respironics knew its breathing devices had a problem: Foam inside the CPAP machines,  which help people with sleep apnea breathe at night, was breaking off into black flecks and blowing into the mouths and noses of users.

title: As U.K. Braces for Painful Budget Cuts, the Mood Is Gloomy
description: SWINDON, England  Britains energy crisis hit Chris Watts quicker and harder than most businesspeople: His company installs and fixes gas boilers. As soon as news of skyrocketing fuel bills surfaced in August, he said, customers began putting off repairs and replacements. Desperate to cut expenses, many have yet to switch on the heat in their houses.

title: A Teacher-Created Unit on Race and Racism Using The New York Times
description: This idea was submitted by Barbara Sarbin, who teaches civics to grades 6-8 at the Volcano School of Arts and Sciences, a public charter school in Volcano, Hawaii.

title: Wealthy Nations Offer Indonesia $20 Billion to Curb Coal
description: SHARM EL SHEIKH, Egypt  Indonesia, one of the worlds largest consumers of coal, pledged to sharply reduce its reliance on the fossil fuel and speed up its transition to renewable power as part of a $20 billion climate finance deal announced on Tuesday with the United States, Japan and other developed countries.

title: Novak Djokovic Is Cleared to Play in Australian Open
description: Australia has cleared the way for the tennis star Novak Djokovic to seek his 22nd Grand Slam title at the upcoming Australian Open, lifting a three-year ban from the country that was imposed in January when he was deported over his failure to be vaccinated against Covid.

title: As Europe Quits Russian Gas, Half of Frances Nuclear Plants Are Off-Line
description: An army of engineers has fanned out through nuclear power plants across France in recent months, inspecting reactors for signs of wear and tear. Hundreds of expert welders have been recruited to repair problems found in cooling circuits. Stress tests are being conducted to check for safety problems.

title: Should We Still Be Sending Astronauts to Space?
description: Have you ever dreamed of becoming an astronaut or working for NASA?

title: Why Did We Put So Much Faith in the Crypto Whiz Kid?
description: Disheveled, young and exceedingly brainy, Sam Bankman-Fried perfectly fit the role of a Silicon Valley mogul in the making. Mr. Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old founder of the cryptocurrency exchange FTX, leaned into the Silicon Valley stereotype and then some, playing video games while pitching investors and wearing a T-shirt and shorts onstage with Bill Clinton and Tony Blair. Blue-chip investors fell for his persona, and Mr. Bankman-Fried profited greatly, with his estimated net worth reaching over $26 billion at one point.

title: Is It OK That My Wife Posts Photos of Her Breastfeeding Our Son?
description: Im proud of my wife and her breastfeeding of my son  I am so glad that they have been able to experience the bonding and health benefits that come with breastfeeding. My concern arises from the fact that my wife has posted photos online of her breastfeeding. These are not photos where everything happens to be conveniently covered up. You can see it all. I understand that my wifes Instagram accounts are private, in that only connections/followers can see posts. These people range from family members, close friends of hers, close friends of mine, acquaintances and business contacts. I have asked her about the photos, and in particular what the thought process was behind posting them. She said that breastfeeding is something she is proud of and wants to share with her contacts.

title: A Survival Guide for the End of the World
description: The opening passages of How to Survive Everything, the new novel from the Scottish writer Ewan Morrison, gave me serious its happening again vibes. Here we are in late 2022, still navigating life with Covid-19, and Morrison makes the bold move of setting his book  which was first published internationally in 2021 before coming to the United States now  in the not-too-distant future, at the onset of the next viral catastrophe.

title: How Democrats Can Build a John Fetterman 2.0
description: When John Fetterman announced his candidacy for the U.S. Senate early in 2021, he vowed to compete everywhere, including areas of Pennsylvania that feel left behind and not part of the conversation. His campaign mantra was, Every county, every vote.

title: A Life of Shirley Hazzard, Sublime Chronicler of Affairs of the Heart
description: In 2003, at the 92nd Street Y, the writer Shirley Hazzard spoke of her new novel, The Great Fire, which would go on to win a National Book Award a few weeks later. She said: The world likes to trace the authors life in the novel but the obvious isnt always true. Something that was very close to you and resembles your experience isnt necessarily the deepest version of the story.  One feels for another person. One observes. One imagines.

title: The Desert Changed My Life. It Can Change Yours, Too.
description: On a frigid March morning in 2022, a friend and I were visiting the Mojave National Preserve in Californias San Bernardino County. Joshua trees, normally crooked and whimsical with spiky green leaves, were instead blanched white and charred, limbs swinging in 25-mile-per-hour winds. Creosote bushes, blackbrush and yucca  all of which were once shelter or food for jackrabbits, night lizards and ground squirrels  had also been scorched. In August 2020, the Dome Fire burned more than a million Joshua trees alone, leaving skeletal remains of what had been a dense woodland.

title: A Reunion as Grueling, and Gorgeous, as a Ballet en Pointe
description: Carlisle Martin, the 43-year-old choreographer protagonist at the center of Meg Howreys fourth novel, struggles to make dances that will disrupt classical ballets often formulaic roles and plotlines. There are no mothers-in-law in ballet, she paraphrases the renowned choreographer George Balanchine. In other words, this is not an art form suited for portraying complicated family relationships, or psychological subtleties.

title: When Flying a Plane Was Thrilling  and Often Fatal
description: Aviation has become just another boring part of modern infrastructure. Some people are afraid of it. Most people endure it. Few people bother to look out the window for a view of Earth that was unimaginable to most of our ancestors, or to reflect on the miracle of technology, engineering and organization that daily airline operations represent. Before the pandemic, roughly three million passengers took flights to or from U.S. airports each day, which averages out to more than one billion passenger journeys per year. (Traffic has nearly returned to that level.) Over the past 13 years, through more than 10 billion passenger journeys, a total of two people have died in U.S. airline accidents.

title: Do Thank-You Notes Still Matter?
description: These days, checking your mailbox can be a disheartening experience. You shuffle past catalogs and bills, riffling through political fliers and advertising postcards addressed to Resident. But sometimes, if youre lucky, you come across an envelope with handwriting that you recognize, thanking you for something you did, or gave.

title: Michelle Obama Has Some Advice
description: Its not easy being Michelle Obama. Fabulous, yes. Easy, no. She is a world-class worrier, a change-avoider and, by her own admission, a bit of a nervous Nellie. (As a child, she almost missed her chance to be in a Christmas play, wearing a beloved red velvet dress and patent leather shoes, because she was terrified of sharing the stage with a stuffed turtle.) And lets just say that spontaneity is not her strong suit: Im not a leaper or a flier, but a deliberate, rung by rung ladder climber, writes the former first lady in her new book, The Light We Carry. Im pretty sure she makes lists, then makes lists of those lists, then color-codes them all.

title: Schumer Urges Republicans to Jettison Trump and Work With Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Chuck Schumer has a postelection proposition for Republicans: Dump Donald J. Trump and join with Democrats to enact popular legislation.

title: Why Trump Could Win Again
description: Because American politics has been so dominated by an entertainer, the most inevitable thing in the world is a sequel.

title: Sugar Alcohols Are in Many Sugar-Free Foods. What Are They?
description: Q: Ive noticed that more and more diet and sugar-free food products contain ingredients called sugar alcohols. What are they? And are they any better for you than table sugar?

title: As Migrants Leave Tent Shelter, Mayor Defends His Strategy
description: Jose Manaure said he felt relieved that he would be leaving the tent shelter on Randalls Island for a hotel in downtown Manhattan, where it will be easier for him to look for jobs.

title: Republicans 2022 Lesson: Voters Who Trust Elections Are More Likely to Vote
description: PHOENIX  It was early on Election Day when polling places in Maricopa County started experiencing a glitch. Tabulation machines were rejecting thousands of ballots, a result of a printer error, and the confusion was causing lines and frustration at the polls.

title: World Leaders Meet as Global Economy Faces Multiple Threats
description: BALI, Indonesia  World leaders gathered on Tuesday at a moment of severe geopolitical turmoil, as the global economy slinks toward recession, weighed down by high inflation, a growing scarcity of food and the side-by-side threats of oil shock and financial crisis.

title: What Does Your Favorite Restaurant Reservation App Say About You?
description: OpenTable is economy. Resy is premium economy. Tock is business class.

title: Bill McKibben on the Power That Could Save the Planet
description: The fight against climate change is at a crossroads.

title: Is Rock Climbing the Future of Tourism in Malawi?
description: Fifty feet above, a pack of yellow baboons rollicked and screeched across a cliff of sheer black granite. An iridescent blue lizard darted into a crack to my left. I was 750 feet up the 5,600-foot dome of Chambe, a peak within the Mulanje Massif, in southern Malawi. On one of only a handful of rock climbs in the country, I felt like I was on another planet, my senses in overdrive. Behind me, low-slung clouds like clinging cobwebs blanketed green plains.

title: In Poland, a Warm Welcome for Ukrainian Refugees Wobbles
description: LODZ, Poland  Andrzej Kompa, a Polish historian appalled by his governments past denunciations of migrants as a disease-carrying menace, was pleasantly surprised when Poland opened its arms this year to millions of people fleeing war in neighboring Ukraine.

title: Ukraines 15,000-Mile Lifeline
description: On the night of Feb. 23, when Kyiv was still rife with rumors and denials about the Russian troops and weaponry amassing along the border, Oleksandr Kamyshin, the 38-year-old chief executive of Ukrzaliznytsia  Ukraines national rail system  sent a photograph to the managements Telegram group chat in an attempt to settle everyones nerves. The photo showed him tucking his two sons, 8 and 12, into bed in their apartment in central Kyiv. The head of passenger services, Oleksandr Pertsovskyi, replied with a photo of his toddler taking a bath. The implication of both photos was clear: The leaders, and their families, were staying put.

title: After a Perilous Journey, Migrants Try to Make It in New York City
description: Alberto Azuna stood on the corner of 125th Street and Third Avenue in Manhattan on a recent morning and adjusted his baseball cap. He squirmed inside a tight winter jacket, then straightened himself. OK, lets go down this way, he said.

title: Trump has filed the official paperwork to run for president in 2024.
description: Former President Donald J. Trump is expected to announce a 2024 presidential bid on Tuesday, his third campaign for the office, shortly after he filed the official paperwork to do so. A growing number of Republicans, however, see him as a political liability given the partys showing in the midterm elections.

title: Film Club: Long Line of Ladies
description: Long Line of Ladies is a 22-minute Op-Doc film that touches on themes of adulthood, community, family and tradition. It brings audiences into the world of Ahtyirahm Ahty Allen, a 13-year-old member of Northern Californias Karuk tribe, as she anticipates her Ihuk or Flower Dance  a once-dormant coming-of-age ceremony that takes place after young women in her community have their first period. This beautifully captured film takes us on a journey of tradition and self-discovery, allowing us to peek behind the curtain of a ceremony in the Karuk tribe that was nearly lost until its revival in the 1990s.

title: Another Trump Campaign
description: Days after voters rejected his vision for the country in the midterms, former President Donald J. Trump is expected to announce a third run for president.

title: In Their First Loss, the Eagles Score Early and Then Slumber
description: PHILADELPHIA  Last week, when a certain Jimmy Johnson said he was not yet sold on the Philadelphia Eagles, despite their 8-0 start, guard Landon Dickerson was baffled.

title: Trumps Precarious Moment
description: There will be no golden escalator this time, but neither will there be mocking guffaws or can-you-believe-this eye-rolling. As Donald Trump is expected to kick off another presidential campaign tonight, the world has changed rather drastically since his first. Whatever else is thought of his attempted comeback, it will not be dismissed as an implausible joke.

title: Leaving Brooklyn for the Burbs
description: Making the move was easier than they expected. A gut renovation that took just six weeks helped.

title: Leaving Brooklyn for Connecticut Was Easier Than They Thought
description: Like many New Yorkers who left the city in the early days of the pandemic, Elana Tenenbaum Cline and Daniel Cline assumed it was a temporary measure. When they decamped from their Brooklyn apartment to Ms. Tenenbaum Clines parents house in Connecticut with their newborn son, Noah, they expected to return to the city within a couple of months.

title: Xi holds talks with Australias prime minister, ending a yearslong freeze in top-level talks.
description: Building on his summit on Monday with President Biden, President Xi Jinping of China held talks on Tuesday with Australias prime minister, Anthony Albanese, ending Beijings yearslong freeze on top-level talks between the two trade partners.

title: Marie Kondo Takes On a New Role: Life Coach
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: A reopened rail route to Mykolaiv restores some order amid war.
description: KYIV, Ukraine  The big board at Kyivs central train station has for months been a long list of destinations that were unreachable because of the war.

title: Palestinian Assailant Kills 3 Israelis in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  A Palestinian assailant stabbed several civilians in an Israeli-controlled industrial zone in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday, then fled by car and continued his deadly rampage along a highway, where he hit another person with the vehicle. Three Israelis were killed and several more were severely wounded at various points along the assailants path, according to the Israeli ambulance service.

title: Walmart Defies Gloom Over Inflation With Sales and Profit Upgrade
description: Walmart on Tuesday reported a rise in sales in its latest quarter, signaling that consumers continued to spend despite high inflation and that the retail behemoth had moved past the missteps that plagued it earlier this year. It also increased its full-year forecast for revenue and profit, and projected confidence by announcing a $20 billion share buyback.

title: Why the G20 Summit Matters to Investors
description: The Group of 20 summit in Bali was always going to be dominated by Russias war in Ukraine and the fear of a global recession caused by the food and energy crisis it has triggered. But positive noises after talks on the eve of the meeting between President Biden and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, have offered a glimmer of hope, even though deep divisions remain.

title: U.C. Workers Strike on All 10 Campuses
description: LOS ANGELES  In what organizers are calling the largest strike in the history of U.S. higher education, tens of thousands of academic workers across the University of California system walked off the job on Monday to call for higher wages and better benefits.

title: For the Want of an Insulation Screw
description: Like many development projects in the pandemic, construction of the Applied Research Center at Florida Polytechnic University was burdened by delays. Skanska, the general contractor responsible for the building, struggled to find materials.

title: In Brazil, Lula Beat Bolsonaro. Now Comes the Hard Part.
description: BRASLIA  The baseball caps, red with white block letters, were meant to deliver an unmistakable message: Make Brazil 2002 Again.

title: Charlie Hunnam Is a Cat Person
description: Seven years ago, the British actor Charlie Hunnam took a book with him on an overseas vacation and was so engrossed that he didnt get around to sightseeing.

title: Collapsed Crypto Exchange FTX Could Owe More Than 1 Million Creditors
description: The collapsed crypto exchange FTX and its related businesses could owe money to more than one million people and organizations, according to documents filed in bankruptcy court on Monday, illustrating the scope of a corporate meltdown that has drained traders accounts and plunged the cryptocurrency industry into crisis.

title: Prominent Egyptian Political Prisoner Ends Hunger Strike, Family Says
description: CAIRO  Alaa Abd El Fattah, the imprisoned British-Egyptian dissident who has been on hunger strike for more than seven months in a bid to win his freedom, has broken his strike even though he remains behind bars, his family said on Tuesday.

title: Old Latin Mass Finds New American Audience, Despite Popes Disapproval
description: DETROIT  Eric Agustins eight children used to call the first day of the week Party Sunday. The family would wake up, attend a short morning Mass at a Catholic parish near their house, then head home for lunch and an afternoon of relaxing and watching football.

title: Biden and Xi Break the Ice
description: The leaders of the worlds 20 biggest economies are meeting this week in Indonesia.

title: World Population Reaches 8 Billion, U.N. Says
description: Until 1804, fewer than one billion people roamed our planet. More than a century later, in 1927, we crossed two billion.

title: In Colombia, Drilling Pays the Bills. The Countrys Leaders Want to Quit Oil.
